According to Rep. Joe Kennedy III (D-MA), Fall River, Massachusetts, the host-city of his response to President Donald Trump’s recent State of the Union address was “built by immigrants.” However, this statement is MOSTLY FALSE. While it is true that a wave of immigrants did come to settle in the town at the end of the 19th Century, what we now know as Fall River was in fact first established in the 1600s by English colonists, not immigrants. The Bordens, who were native-born, ran a mill in the town for generations, both before and after the American Revolution. It was not until the advent of industrialization in 1811, brought about by the efforts of Col. Joseph Durfee, a native-born Revolutionary War hero, that the town really began to take shape. While it is true that immigrants did make up a significant portion of the town’s population at their early 20th Century peak, they never represented a majority of the population of Bristol County, where Fall River is located.

Brian Kline is the type of person who voted for President Donald Trump in November. He’s a working-class man whose job is in retail, scoring him $11.66/hour. Thanks to Medicaid he’s being treated for cancer. During the CNN town hall with Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price, Kline explained his situation and his struggles. “My question is pretty straightforward,” Kline told Price. “Why do you want to take away my Medicaid expansion?” Price’s dispassionate answer seemed to fall flat on the audience. “I took care of a lot of patients with cancer,” Price explained about his 20 years as an orthopedic surgeon. “We don’t want to take care away from anybody. What we want to make certain, though, is that every single American has access to the kind of coverage and care that they want for themselves.”“But, what if there are people out there who are going to die more quickly because of what you’re doing here, because you’re essentially taking medical care away from people who need it the most?” Kline wouldn’t back down. “Are you saying you actually want people to be okay with that?” Price thought for a second, then replied: “Look, I understand how all of this sounds right now, but you know, there comes a time in everyone’s life when they just have to stop talking B.S. and be practical. As of right now, the fact to the matter is, our national budget is hemorrhaging money because of Obamacare. And believe me – I get how insensitive that sounds, but at the end of the day, we have to stop ignoring the facts here.”He continued, “I understand that this is not something anyone wants to hear, especially people who’ve got worse problems to deal with than the state of the national budget, but this is one of those situations where the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few. When President Trump assumed office, he was appalled at the state of the national budget and our finances. It doesn’t take a rocket scientist to figure out that Barack Obama was to blame, since he’s the one who left the hot potato behind for us to deal with. Now, I’m not going to go into whether or not he did that on purpose, but at the end of the day, all I can say is, we have to fix the problem or else we’re looking at nationwide riots and another economic recession.”“Put simply, we have to plug some holes – of which, by the way, there are plenty – and we kind of have to start with the biggest ones,” the orthopedic surgeon added. “Unfortunately for millions of people across the country, Obamacare seems to be the biggest one by far. Besides, there are more ways than one to look at this picture. I know it’s not pretty, but at the end of the day, even people who are able to fight off cancer – I’m sure you know what I’m talking about, Brian – they can’t lead 100 percent normal lives, ever again. What kind of an existence is that, to have to survive instead of live?”“At the risk of sounding insensitive, we’ve pretty much got two choices here: we either repeal Obamacare, or we take out more loans from countries like China. And nobody wants to be in debt to the Chinese. At the end of the day, it’s better for our national budget if cancer patients pass away more quickly, it’s a lousy way to live anyway, and I’m sorry to say it out loud, but it’s the truth,” Price concluded.

According to the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), the most recent numbers on food stamp enrollment reveal that approximately four million people dropped off the food stamp rolls in a single month. This staggering decline in beneficiaries of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), which administers food stamps, saw the number of participants decrease from 45,666,795 in October 2017 to 41,658,868 in November 2017 - a decrease of 4,007,927 in just one month. Although a short-term increase in enrollment occurred in certain states due to natural disasters, the nationwide trend in food stamp enrollment is continuously declining, which began after state legislatures enacted welfare reform measures designed to return people to the workforce. The Trump administration followed suit by implementing similar measures such as requiring food stamp recipients to work a specific number of hours per week, thus causing nationwide enrollment in the SNAP program to drop even further. In the past year alone, enrollment in SNAP has dropped by two million, with the downward trend continuing since 2013.

Living in large homes with plenty of storage space makes us unaware of its importance. In contrast, tiny houses have limited space, so storage space becomes a crucial factor that owners must consider while building, furnishing, or buying a tiny home. Planning for storage space is an integral part of preparing for tiny living as downsizing alone cannot solve the issue. 
Florida tiny homes have limited floor space, making vertical storage a practical solution. Wall-mounted shelves are inexpensive and easy to install, saving valuable floor space. Multi-functional furniture, such as beds with drawers for linen storage or coffee tables with integrated storage drawers, is also ideal for tiny homes. 
Customized furniture is highly beneficial for tiny homes that do not have a standard floor plan. It allows maximum utilization of space while serving necessary functions. Despite the premium price, customized furniture is a worthwhile investment for comfortable tiny living. 
Appliances and furniture take up valuable space in tiny homes, so smaller options are ideal. Sacrificing full-sized appliances, such as stoves, for dual heat-plate designs or opting for small refrigerators can create more storage space. Tiny appliances may cost more than standard ones, but they offer more functionality and lead to a healthier lifestyle by encouraging fresh grocery shopping.

We all know that the recently passed tax bill is likely the single worst piece of legislation in the history of American politics. You know it, I know it, Paul Ryan knows it, Donald Trump knows it. Well, Trump probably doesn’t, because, well, he’s delusional.But it’s really, really bad. And historically unpopular, like the President whose name will forever be attached to it.Maybe you aren’t totally convinced about how bad it is yet. So there’s this: Under this plan, a wealthy CEO can deduct a private jet, but a police officer cannot deduct his/her uniform.“Yeah, but they’re the party of ‘Blue Lives Matter’ and thanking everyone who ever wore a uniform for anything for their service!” you might say. And I have some oceanfront property in Idaho to sell you if you believe that.Salon reports, Donald Trump often declares his support, even love, for police, firefighters and other first responders. That isn’t stopping him, however, from nicking their wallets in the new tax law that he is expected to sign in early January.Buried in the hastily drafted tax bill’s more than 500 pages are provisions eliminating “miscellaneous” deductions taken by almost 28 million taxpayers in 2015. Those are costs you bore to support your job or an investment you own or to pay a professional to prepare your income tax return.This year cops and other first responders can write off the costs of buying uniforms and dry cleaning them. But in 2018, cops who buy their uniforms or are required to buy their own guns and ammunition will no longer be able to deduct those costs as reasonable and necessary expenses to support their earning a paycheck, thanks to Trump and Congressional Republicans.But that’s not all. Cops and anyone else who belongs to a union will no longer be allowed to deduct their union dues. People who must bear travel costs without reimbursement from their employers will just have to suck it up starting in January.Add police officers, the military, teachers, nurses and first responders to the long, long list of hard working Americans that Donald Trump and the Republican party want to make suffer. And all to give the wealthiest among us more wealth.Shameful.

COSTA MESA, Ca. - Republican party's presidential candidate and the front-runner, Donald Trump has introduced his plan to revive America's military might. During a speech given on Thursday evening, the billionaire and construction mogul said that he intends to strengthen America's defense by reinstating compulsory military service, popularly known as the draft. The move comes as part of a larger effort to revamp the country's military, which he said had been left weakened by years of underfunding and neglect.
Speaking to a crowd in California, the presidential candidate expressed his intentions to reintroduce the draft under his administration, stating that the current US military is stretched too thin, and the young men and women of America are neglected for employment opportunities and their contribution to the nation's safety and security.
Trump's proposal to reinstate the draft model is said to include all men and women in their twenties, with no exemptions. Furthermore, the candidate highlighted his willingness to work with Congress to increase military expenditure, staffing, recruitment, and technological advancement to better equip US forces against potential adversaries.
Concerns, however, have been raised due to the proposal's potential implications for hundreds and thousands of young Americans. At present, the US military operates by staff volunteering, and there are more than 1.2 million active-duty service members.
Trump's plan to bring back the draft is expected to ignite a national conversation about the military's mission, the army's budgeting, as well as the importance of America's role as a global superpower. With the presidential elections only a few months away, the Republican's vision for the future of America's military will remain a topic of debate among the Democratic peers for some time to come.

Bumble Bee Foods and two of its managers have been charged with violating safety regulations after an employee died in an industrial oven being used to process tuna. Jose Melena was carrying out maintenance work on the oven in the company’s Santa Fe Springs plant when a co-worker accidentally switched it on, apparently unaware that Melena was inside. His body was found two hours later when the oven was opened. Prosecutors from Los Angeles have charged the company, Operations Director Angel Rodriguez and former safety manager Saul Florez each with three counts of violating Occupational Safety & Health Administration rules that led to the fatality. Bumble Bee Foods faces fines of up to $1.5m, whilst Rodriguez and Florez could be imprisoned for three years and fined up to $250k.

The issue of abolishing the agency responsible for enforcing federal immigration laws has become a focal point for many Democrats considering a run for the presidency in 2020. The idea, once a hallmark of far-left ideology, has gained mainstream traction in recent months amongst those on the left who are protesting the Trump administration's policies toward illegal immigration. Advocates for this proposal, including liberal writers and commentators, believe that the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement is operating as an "unaccountable deportation force" and must be reformed. This sentiment has even been echoed by high-profile Democrats such as former Hillary Clinton aide Brian Fallon and former Attorney General under President Obama, Eric Holder. However, the acting director of ICE, Thomas Homan, has dismissed these calls, stating that politicians critical of the agency should speak with victims of illegal immigrant crime. Recently, Democratic Senator Kamala Harris faced criticism from liberal publications for not taking her criticisms of ICE far enough. Other potential Democratic candidates such as Bernie Sanders, Kirsten Gillibrand, Elizabeth Warren, and Eric Garcetti, have also been called upon to weigh in on the issue. The liberal magazine, The Nation, has published an article titled, "It's Time to Abolish ICE," and accuses the agency of being a part of an "unbridled white-supremacist surveillance state." Meanwhile, California's "open borders" policies have been a flashpoint for lawmakers, with House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi recently criticizing the tactics of ICE and Attorney General Jeff Sessions calling such policies "radical" and "irrational." Ultimately, the debate around immigration will be a major factor in the upcoming 2020 presidential race, as candidates look to address the concerns of a country struggling to find unified solutions to a complex issue.

News reports have confirmed that actor Kirk Douglas died of natural causes late this afternoon, Los Angeles coroners office reported. This was just 4 days before he would have turned 101 years old.Family released a statement saying he “went comfortably and was in no pain” and “lived a long and prosperous life that people only dream of.”Kirk Douglas was an American actor, producer, director, and author. He was one of the last living people of the film industry’s Golden Age. After an impoverished childhood with immigrant parents and six sisters, he had his film debut in The Strange Love of Martha Ivers (1946) with Barbara Stanwyck. Douglas soon developed into a leading box-office star throughout the 1950s and 1960s, known for serious dramas, including westerns and war movies. During his career he appeared in more than 90 movies. Douglas was well known for his explosive acting style.As an actor and philanthropist, Douglas had received three Academy Award nominations, an Oscar for Lifetime Achievement, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. As an author, he had written ten novels and memoirs. He was No. 17 on the American Film Institute’s list of the greatest male screen legends of classic Hollywood cinema, and the highest-ranked living person on the list. After barely surviving a helicopter crash in 1991 and then suffering a stroke in 1996, he had focused on renewing his spiritual and religious life. He lived with his second wife (of 63 years), Anne Buydens, a producer. He was to turn 101 on December 9, 2016.

President Obama, along with his family, assisted in serving Thanksgiving dinner to the homeless at Friendship Place in Washington as a way to showcase the administration's efforts to end homelessness among US veterans. The shelter, which operates the Veterans First program, was granted $3.1 million by the Department of Veterans Affairs this year to expand its ability to handle veteran homelessness. The Obama family, along with friends, helped serve food at the "Feast with Friends" event, with each member being responsible for specific tasks. Since June 2010, the White House has worked to end homelessness, and this year they have concentrated on helping homeless veterans. As a result, homeless veterans have decreased by 36% since 2010, while unsheltered homelessness among veterans decreased by 50% during the same period.

The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) will soon be sending letters to approximately 13 million individuals aged 65 and above, as President Trump has extended a Christmas stimulus to help offset the poor performance of this year's Black Friday. Eligibility criteria for this stimulus are being over 65, retired, receiving social security, and having an income below $40,000 per annum. The stimulus is part of the Chief Executive's yearly discretionary budget, and the remaining funds for 2017 will be allocated to qualified recipients. Each eligible recipient will receive a letter from the IRS.
Additionally, the letter will include an offer to pledge support for President Trump. While Attorney General William Barr has clarified that this action is legal and patriotic, it may not be enforceable in its entirety. According to the White House Director of Information and Propaganda, Art Trubolls, the offer is accompanied by fine print to ensure that individuals who oppose President Trump do not misinterpret the intention behind this gesture.
President Trump enjoys the highest approval rating among seniors of all the presidents in the history of the United States. Supporters of President Trump exemplify the essence of the American spirit. While this stimulus is indicative of his commitment towards the welfare of society's most vulnerable, it is also aimed at creating unison and loyalty among citizens of America.
If you do not receive a letter and believe you are eligible, contact the White House switchboard at (202) 456-1414 to communicate your concern.

Saturday February 3 2018 by Michele Facebook  Twitter  Pinterest  Google+ #1 No More Smoking In Cars With Children The law, that becomes effective on January 30, 2018 is to protect children from secondhand smoking. Violations would result in a fine of up to $100. Facebook  Twitter  Pinterest  Google+ #2 Thousands Of Chemicals According to the Department of Health, when a child breathes in secondhand smoke, they breathe in thousands of chemicals, just like the smoker does. This puts them at risk of serious conditions including cancer, bronchitis, and pneumonia. And it can worsen asthma. Facebook  Twitter  Pinterest  Google+ #3 All Private Vehicles The law applies to any private vehicle that is enclosed wholly or partly by a roof. It still applies if people have the windows or sunroof open, have the air-conditioning on, or if they sit in a parked car with the door open. Facebook  Twitter  Pinterest  Google+ #4 All Out Ban? This comes as the federal agency Housing and Urban Development is rolling out its nationwide ban on smoking in public housing, and just a few years after many states have outlawed smoking in beaches and public parks. This trend raises the question: Are we getting closer to prohibiting tobacco smoking altogether? And would that be such a bad thing? Facebook  Twitter  Pinterest  Google+ “In America, it’s very difficult to be simply paternalistic,” Ronald Bayer, co-director of the Center for the History and Ethics of Public Health at Columbia University’s Mailman School of Public Health, tells Yahoo Lifestyle. American values of privacy and freedom make it very difficult to prohibit anything as mainstream as tobacco, even if it’s to save the lives of smokers. That old “nanny state” argument rears its head every time. With millions of people still addicted to cigarettes, there is also the very real fear that a ban would spawn a black market similar to what exists with illegal drugs or what happened with alcohol during Prohibition. Facebook  Twitter  Pinterest  Google+ 5. What's Next? Bayer suggests that one way to help people quit would be by tackling the problem from the supply side. “I think we would do much better to think about reducing the nicotine content, so that the addictive quality of cigarettes wasn’t as severe, and make quitting easier.” The World Health Organization’s Framework Convention on Tobacco Control established a method called MPOWER in 2008 that aims to end the “global tobacco epidemic,” which kills over 7 million people each year. The way to do this is not by banning it all at once, but instead by monitoring use and prevention, protecting citizens from second-hand smoke, offering ways to help people quit, warning people of the dangers of smoking, enforcing bans on advertising, and raising taxes on tobacco products.If you like this blog don't forget to share it.You are currently reading about Smoking In Cars With Children Is Illegal Starting January 30, 2018. If you've found this helpful, please share Smoking In Cars With Children Is Illegal Starting January 30, 2018 on your favorite social media site, such as Facebook, Twitter, or Google+

Breaking News Emails Get breaking news alerts and special reports. The news and stories that matter, delivered weekday mornings.An aide for Rep. Debbie Wasserman Schultz, D-Fla., has been arrested for attempting to flee the country and charged with bank fraud, officials said.Imran Awan, 37, was arrested on Monday by FBI agents and U.S. Capitol Police at Dulles International Airport trying to fly to Lahore, Pakistan.Awan was arraigned in U.S. District Court on Tuesday with one count of bank fraud, a federal offense, and he pleaded not guilty.Officials said Awan and his wife, Hina Alvi, defrauded the Congressional Federal Credit Union for $165,000 by lying on a home equity loan application, according to federal court documents.Awan worked as an information technology staffer for Wasserman Schultz, a former chairwoman of the Democratic National Committee. David Damron, a spokesman for her office, said he was fired Tuesday.Congresswoman and DNC Chair Debbie Wasserman Schultz on December 19, 2015. Pacific Press / LightRocket via Getty Images"Mr. Awan previously served as an employee in our office, but his services have been terminated," Damron said in a emailed statement.Awan and his wife, who also worked as a House aide, applied for the loan in December last year and told the loan officer that their Virginia residence listed on the application to secure the loan was not used as a rental property, court documents said.The credit union does not provide loans based on homes that are used for rental income because they are a "riskier" forms of collateral, according to court documents.However, federal agents interviewed several unidentified people who had rental agreements with the couple at the residence, according to court documents.The credit union also required that the home listed on the application to be the primary residence of Awan and his wife. However, through surveillance, federal agents noted in court records that the couple was also residing at two other residences.Awan's wife initiated a $283,000 wire transfer in January 2017 through the credit union to Faisalabad, Pakistan, which included the $165,000 loan, according to court documents.His wife and their three children left the country in March with $12,700 cash from Dulles International Airport to Lahore, according to court documents.Officials said they do not believe that his wife plans to return to the U.S.Awan was released after his arraignment and is under a "high-intensity supervision program," said Bill Miller, a U.S. Attorney’s office spokesman.Awan received a GPS monitor and has a 10 p.m. to 6 a.m. curfew. He also must remain in a 50-mile radius of his Virginia residence. Awan was also ordered to turn over all of his passports.A hearing is slated for August 21.Awan’s lawyer, Christopher Gowen, said the charges are politically-motivated and "began as part of a frenzy of anti-Muslim bigotry in the literal heart of our democracy, the House of Representatives.""For months we have had utterly unsupported, outlandish, and slanderous statements targeting Mr. Awan coming not just from the ultra-right-wing 'pizzagate' media but from sitting members of Congress," Gowen said in an emailed statement."Now we have the Justice Department showing up with a complaint about disclosures on a modest real estate matter. To an extent, the situation speaks for itself."

С наступлением нового года многие люди начинают планировать свои праздники. Чтобы сделать это правильно, нужно учитывать некоторые факторы. Поэтому, чтобы помочь нашим читателям в планировании новогодней вечеринки, AdMe.ru предлагает несколько полезных советов.
Во-первых, запланируйте мероприятия заранее. Вы можете начать планировать свою вечеринку за две недели до праздника. Определите, сколько человек нужно пригласить, какую музыку воспроизводить и какие блюда подавать.

Наконец, не забывайте, что новогодние праздники – это время, когда люди могут расслабиться и насладиться жизнью в кругу близких и друзей. Поэтому, не стесняйтесь расслабиться и насладиться настоящим праздником.

Recent research suggests that many individuals experience moments of laziness and a desire to retreat to the comfort of their bed. While this may seem like a harmless and understandable sentiment, experts warn that this mentality could have serious consequences on one’s overall well-being.
As highlighted by various studies, prolonged periods of inactivity and isolation can lead to feelings of depression, anxiety, and a lack of purpose. Moreover, remaining in bed for extended periods can cause physical health concerns, such as muscle atrophy and decreased cardiovascular function.
To combat these negative outcomes, experts recommend incorporating small but achievable tasks into daily routines, seeking support from loved ones, and seeking professional help if needed. While taking a break from the chaos of daily life may seem appealing, it is crucial to make sure that these moments of respite do not transform into long-term habits that jeopardize one’s mental and physical health.

The West Texas Federal Appeals Court, operating out of the 33rd District, made a landmark decision in a recent case involving former President Barack Obama. The court has ordered that Mr. Obama repay $400 million to the American people for funds that were reported as “lost” during an illegal transaction with Iranian hard-liners. 
According to court records, the transaction in question took place in 2016 when Mr. Obama authorized the transfer of $1.7 billion in cash to Iran. The funds were said to be a settlement for decades-old legal claims between the US and Iran, and were authorized to be transferred in cash to avoid US financial sanctions against Iran. 
However, during the transfer, $400 million in cash was loaded onto pallets and flown to Tehran in secret. The Obama administration later claimed that the transfer was actually a payment for military equipment that was never delivered to Iran after the 1979 Iranian Revolution. 
The court has declared that the transfer was illegal, as it violated both US law and international sanctions on Iran. The order for Mr. Obama to repay the $400 million is a significant victory for the American people, who have long been concerned about the legality of the transfer.
The ruling also serves as a warning to future administrations that they must act within the bounds of US law and international norms. The West Texas Federal Appeals Court has made it clear that the American people will hold their leaders accountable for any illegal actions, no matter how high their office. 
This decision has already sparked controversy and debate on both sides of the political aisle. Many are calling for further investigation and clarification of the legalities surrounding the transfer. Whatever the outcome, this ruling marks a significant moment in American history, reinforcing the importance of upholding the rule of law and ensuring accountability from our leaders.

This article has been updated to clarify that there is no suspicion linking Jesus Fabian Gonzales to the recent wildfires in Sonoma County that tragically claimed the lives of 40 residents. It has come to light that the U.S. Immigration & Customs Enforcement Agency (ICE) issued a detainer request for Mr. Gonzales, who was arrested on Sunday on charges of arson in connection with the Wine Country fires. Breitbart News had previously reported that Sonoma County Sheriffs had apprehended the 29-year-old Mr. Gonzales at Maxwell Regional Park after receiving a series of reports of ongoing fires in the area. Witnesses observed Mr. Gonzales emerging from a creek area wearing a jacket around 3:00 p.m. and saw a plume of smoke behind him. Although Mr. Gonzales claimed that he had started the fire to keep warm as he was homeless, temperatures were unseasonably warm at 78 degrees Fahrenheit. He was arrested on suspicion of felony arson and had his bail set at $110,000. According to the Sonoma County Sheriff Public Information Officer, Sergeant Spencer Crum, Mr. Gonzales was also the subject of an ICE detainer request. This is noteworthy because despite declaring itself a "sanctuary county" in 2014, Sonoma County only cooperates with "ICE holds" in cases where the prisoner has been convicted of a felony or a misdemeanor offence that falls within the Trust Act within the last five years. It is as yet unknown whether Mr. Gonzales is in the United States illegally. The American Civil Liberties Union argues that detainers constitute a violation of the Fourth Amendment's protection against "unreasonable searches and seizures." The Sonoma County Sheriff Department's "1.0 Policy Statement" states that "no person shall be held solely on the basis of their immigration status," and that "the immigration status of a person, and the lack of immigration documentation, should have no bearing on the manner in which Sheriff's Office personnel execute their duties." In 2014 and 2015, Sonoma County declined 491 detainer requests, and even after President Trump issued Executive Order 13768 this year, requiring all federal, state, and local governments to comply with ICE detainers, the county refused to do so. Meanwhile, the wildfires have displaced over 102,000 residents, killed dozens of people, and destroyed billions of dollars worth of property.

The National Football League has been accused of indulging black athletes who express their protests against the police, the flag and veterans by kneeling. However, the National Hockey League has taken a different approach. During the National Anthem at a game on Sunday, J.T. Brown of the Tampa Bay Lightning made a “black power” fist, a gesture associated with black supremacist groups. Brown may have been counting on prevailing political correctness to keep his job but events turned out differently.
“This is not, and has never been, about the military or disrespecting the flag,” Brown said in an interview with ESPN. “It is about police brutality, racial injustice, and inequality in this country. It is something that I as well as many others feel needs to be addressed. I love my country, but that doesn’t mean I cannot acknowledge that it is not perfect.”
The owner of the team responded differently. Burt Lancaster announced that the team would be looking for another forward to replace Brown. “We wish Mr. Brown the best, but we feel that he does not embody the values of the Tampa Bay Lightning. We support our country, we support our troops, we support our police, and we support our President.”
Brown will remain on the payroll until the end of the season under the terms of his contract, but he will then be seeking employment elsewhere.

Vick VapoRub is a household name for many families. A quick and easy solution for fever, nasal congestion, and other minor ailments, the ointment has been widely used for years. However, one tragic case has highlighted the importance of caution when using the product, particularly with young children.
A Mexican mother shares her heartbreaking experience of losing her two-year-old baby after using Vick VapoRub to ease his cold symptoms. The mother applied the ointment to her son's chest, back, and under his nose before they fell asleep together. Hours later, she discovered her baby had passed away while she slept next to him.
Medical reports reveal that the child died due to inflammation in the respiratory tract caused by the camphor in the ointment. Although this remedy is effective for adults, for babies under two years old, it increases mucus production by 60%, which accumulates in the trachea and blocks breathing.
The label clearly warns that the ointment is contraindicated for children under three years old, and it is thus essential to read the instructions and seek medical advice before using any home remedy. While using home remedies may seem safe, this case serves as a stark reminder to carefully consider all products used, particularly with children's wellbeing at stake.
We must always prioritize safety and seek professional advice before treating any illness, to ensure that no simple mistake takes our loved ones away.

(Jim Lo Scalzo for USN&WR)1. One of six children (and the only daughter), Nancy (Patricia D'Alesandro) Pelosi was born on March 26, 1940, and grew up in Baltimore's Little Italy.2. Pelosi's father, Tommy D'Alesandro, was a legendary Democratic congressman and Baltimore mayor. Her brother Thomas would also go on to become mayor of Baltimore.3. Seemingly, Pelosi was a Democrat from birth—as a young girl, she was offered a toy elephant by a Republican poll worker but recoiled, refusing the toy.4. A devout Catholic, Pelosi attended a Roman Catholic women's college, Trinity College, in Washington, D.C., where she met her future husband, Paul Pelosi, who was attending Georgetown. They eventually relocated to his hometown, San Francisco.5. Pelosi is mother to five—Nancy Corinne, Christine, Jacqueline, Paul, and Alexandra, all born within six years—and grandmother to five.6. Although active in politics her whole life—including stints as a leading Democratic fundraiser and chairwoman of the party in California—Pelosi didn't run for office until she was 47, preferring to wait until the youngest of her five children was a high school senior before running for Congress in 1987.7. Republican National Committee Chairman Ken Mehlman said that she was neither a "new Democrat" nor an "old Democrat" but a "prehistoric Democrat." Other Republicans call her a "latte Democrat" for her politically progressive views on the environment, women's reproductive rights, labor unions, and other issues.8. Pelosi has been a formidable force within the Democratic Party, raising more money than any other congressional Democrat–around $100 million since taking the reins of party leadership. And she has managed to keep the House Dems toeing the party line: According to Congressional Quarterly, House Democrats voted with the majority of their party 88 percent of the time in 2005, the highest total since CQ started keeping track in 1956.9. Pelosi learned the art of politics from her father, a practitioner of old-school politics. To practice her penmanship, "Little Nancy" was in charge of the book in which her New Deal father kept track of favors done and owed.10. A true San Franciscan, Pelosi makes sure that her office is stocked with Ghirardelli chocolates. Her diet typically consists of mostly chocolate and chocolate ice cream. Completing the notoriously challenging New York Times crossword puzzle is one of her favorite hobbies.Sources:www.house.govwww.notablebiographies.comTimeThe GuardianThe EconomistThe New York TimesThe Financial Times

In an age where fake news and doctored photos are becoming a commonplace, it is important to verify the authenticity of such images before drawing any conclusions. Reports of a picture depicting a shark swimming on a Puerto Rico street have been making rounds on social media platforms, causing a stir among the masses. However, closer scrutiny reveals that the image in question is nothing but a cleverly-edited photograph.
The photo, originally shared on Reddit, was soon picked up by several news outlets, alarming people who were already grappling with the havoc caused by natural disasters in Puerto Rico. In fact, the image has been traced back to a 2005 issue of Africa Geographic, wherein it was originally published as a part of an article on shark sightings in the region.
As responsible reporters, it is our duty to inform the public about the veracity of such stories and ensure that they do not fall prey to misinformation. We urge people to be vigilant and cautious when it comes to sharing unverified news in today's world. With the advent of multiple digital platforms, it has become increasingly easy for people to spread fake news and doctored images, making fact-checking a crucial aspect of journalism. It is only through a collective effort that we can combat the spread of fake news and ensure that only accurate and reliable information reaches the masses.

NASA scientists have made an incredible discovery in their latest mission to Jupiter. The gas giant planet is now sporting a newly-formed ring, which astrophysicists attribute to recent human activity. The breakthrough is significant because this is the first time that the creation of rings around planets has been triggered by human technology. The mission, which involved a team of researchers from across the globe, was able to gather data that has allowed them to conclude beyond doubt that this was no natural occurrence but rather the result of human activity.
While there were some initial concerns among the scientific community, particularly about the impact on the planet and its unique atmosphere, the team at NASA expressed relief that the consequences of the human intervention have so far been benign. "They've only started on Jupiter recently, hence the new rings around it. It's all good though, they're a nice enough bunch," they said.
The new discovery will undoubtedly provoke a mix of excitement and concern among the scientific community. While our understanding of the universe is constantly evolving, it is imperative that as humans we pay attention to the impact our actions have on these incredible systems. In this case, the team at NASA is to be congratulated for the innovative approach and the groundbreaking results that they have achieved. It is essential that we continue to collaborate and investigate how we can better support the delicate balance of the planets that exist beyond our own.

It is a question that has been asked in various forms for generations: should immigrants be required to fully assimilate into the culture of their host nation? For some, there is no question: those who choose to migrate should be expected to adopt and respect the values and laws of their new homeland. 
Recently, however, this issue has been thrust into the headlines with renewed fervor following comments by the Islamic activist group Hizb-ut-Tahrir. According to the group's spokesman, Unthman Badar, Australia's insistence on democratic values and a "disputed view" of history is actually a part of an oppressive campaign of "forced assimilation" aimed at the Muslim community.
Critics of this viewpoint argue that immigrants who cannot fully abide by the laws and principles of their adopted nation should not be allowed to enter in the first place. With such strict entrance requirements, the expectation is that those who arrive have made a reasoned, rational decision to adhere to the values and laws of the host country. If they cannot do so, the argument goes, they should not be allowed to enter.
This debate is not unique to Australia. It is one that has arisen in many western countries - the United States, much of Europe, Canada, and elsewhere - and it shows no signs of subsiding. Those who support assimilation argue that it is crucial to maintaining the cohesion and integrity of a society, while opponents of a strict assimilation policy say that immigrants should be allowed to maintain their cultural identity and traditions.
Ultimately, the question of whether immigrants should assimilate fully into their host culture is one that each society must answer for itself. But as the debate continues to rage on, it is clear that it is a question that will not be easily resolved.

London (CNN) Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has lost the last descendant of her original corgi after 14-year-old Willow was put down at Windsor Castle on Sunday following a battle with cancer, according to UK media reports.Willow was the last in a long line of royal corgis owned by Britain's longest-serving monarch, reported British newspaper the Daily Mail.Buckingham Palace declined to comment on the dog's death, telling CNN it was a private matter.The Queen's fondness for corgis is well known, with Willow and the monarch even appearing beside James Bond actor Daniel Craig for a sketch shown during the 2012 London Olympic opening ceremony.Queen Elizabeth II has reportedly owned more than 30 corgis during her reign.While the Queen still reportedly owns several other dogs, Willow was the only remaining descendant of Susan, the original corgi given to then-Princess Elizabeth on her 18th birthday in 1944.Read More

The United States of America, along with thirteen other countries, recently opposed a historic vote in the United Nations on the ban of the death penalty for individuals in same-sex relationships. Notable countries who joined the dissent were China, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt. The resolution in question aimed to prevent the discriminatory implementation of capital punishment in six countries, where it is used for individuals in consensual same-sex relationships: Iran, Saudi Arabia, Sudan, Yemen, Nigeria, and Somalia. It is worth noting that the resolution did not seek to abolish the death penalty altogether.
Despite the ambiguous nature of the resolution, international human rights organizations have condemned the decision of the United States. Renato Sabbadini, the executive director of The International Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans and Intersex Association, stated that it is "unconscionable" to think that people may face death simply because of their sexual orientation.
This recent vote further highlights a worrisome trend of the Trump administration's policies towards the LGBT community. In recent years, the Department of Justice and Education withdrew guidance that protected the rights of transgender students, transgender individuals were banned from serving in the military, and an executive order was signed rescinding Obama-era rule that protected fair treatment of LGBT employees.
Although the measure ultimately passed, the refusal of the United States to join the 27 other countries in voting for this resolution sends a chilling message about the country's stance on human rights. The international community has come together in support of an end to discriminatory laws, and it is imperative that the United States join this effort.

The FBI had gathered evidence that officials in the Russian nuclear industry were engaged in corrupt activities such as bribery, kickbacks, extortion, and money laundering while attempting to expand their atomic energy business within the United States. The FBI used a confidential witness to gather extensive financial records, make secret recordings, and intercept emails as early as 2009. The investigation revealed that Moscow had compromised an American uranium-trucking company with bribes and kickbacks in violation of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Moreover, the FBI obtained evidence indicating that Russian nuclear officials had routed millions of dollars to former President Bill Clinton’s charitable foundation, apparently to benefit Russia’s atomic energy business in the United States during the time that Secretary of State Hillary Clinton served on a government body that provided a favorable decision to Moscow. The racketeering scheme was conducted “with the consent of higher level officials” in Russia who “shared the proceeds” from the kickbacks. Despite this evidence, the Department of Justice continued investigating the matter for nearly four more years, leaving the American public and Congress in the dark about Russian nuclear corruption on U.S. soil. In 2010, the State Department and government agencies on the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States unanimously approved the partial sale of Canadian mining company Uranium One to Russian nuclear giant Rosatom, giving Moscow control of more than 20 percent of America’s uranium supply. In 2011, the administration approved Rosatom’s Tenex subsidiary to sell commercial uranium to U.S. nuclear power plants, furthering Russia’s commercial nuclear ambitions. The Obama administration’s decision to approve Rosatom’s purchase of Uranium One has been a source of political controversy since its approval. The FBI, Energy Department, and court documents reviewed by The Hill show that the FBI had substantial evidence well before the committee’s decision that Vadim Mikerin, the main Russian overseeing Putin’s nuclear expansion inside the United States, was engaged in wrongdoing starting in 2009. Then-Attorney General Eric Holder was among the Obama administration officials joining Hillary Clinton on the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States, yet it is unclear whether the FBI or DOJ ever alerted committee members to the criminal activity they uncovered.

Stephanie Wilkinson, owner of the Red Hen Restaurant in Lexington, Virginia, has faced criticism after asking Sarah Huckabee Sanders to leave the establishment last Friday due to the latter's role as Press Secretary. Despite the backlash, Wilkinson has stood by her decision, stating that "there are moments in time when people need to live their own convictions. This appeared to be one." 
Wilkinson was notified of the concern of Sanders and her group by a member of staff and approached them to ask if they wanted Sanders to be removed from the restaurant. According to Wilkinson, a number of her staff were gay and others were unhappy with Sanders' handling of the border crisis and wanted her gone. After taking Sanders outside to the patio, Wilkinson told her that the restaurant had "certain criteria" such as "honesty, and compassion, and collaboration," and asked her to leave. Sanders agreed and gathered her belongings, with the rest of her party following. Wilkinson comped their meals. 
In response to the incident, President Trump called the restaurant "filthy" on Twitter, and a number of fake reservations were made and the establishment's Yelp rating plummeted. Some reviewers even claimed to have found roaches in their food. Despite this, Wilkinson stands by her decision, stating that "this feels like the moment in our democracy when people need to make uncomfortable actions and decisions to maintain their morals." 
While the incident has sparked debate, it is clear that Wilkinson acted in accordance with her beliefs about the standards that should be upheld in her establishment. Sanders left the restaurant, and the situation has become a matter of public discussion.

Greensburg clown found eating a live cat. Late last night Greensburg police received a phone call from a worried resident saying "she heard very concerning sounds coming from an alley way near her house". Upon arrival officers instantly heard the noise she was talking about but never expected what they where about to see. Upon investigation they found a 21 year old male dressed as a clown eating a live cat who's legs were zip tied together. The cat was still crying for help as the individual was seemingly eating around the vital spots prolonging it's death. When he noticed the officers he started petting the cat and told the officers "curiosity killed the cat, I wanted to see if it tasted like Chinese food." He was non resistant during arrest however did not have identification when asked his name he always replied "furball munchinsrein the clown". In the holding cell it was reported he kept calling to a female officer "here kitty kitty kitty" she eventually approached him and said what he reportedly said "I wonder if you taste like Chinese food come on just let me get one little bite" and continued to bite at the cells bars. He is now in a high security prison for the criminally insane. It was reported that in the asylum he bit open his own fingers and painted himself as a clown with his own blood and refuses to answer questions and instead meows. His trial is on the 31st however police say they doubt he will ever be allowed back into society.

Niagara Falls - In a major recovery operation to retrieve a Nazi submarine discovered at the bottom of Lake Ontario, divers from the U.S coast guard participated this morning. The delicate operation was carried out with precise planning and execution to ensure the safe retrieval of the vessel. The submarine was lying at a depth of over 400 feet and had been resting at the bottom of the lake for several decades.
The team of divers braced challenging conditions, including low visibility and icy temperatures, to execute the operation. The recovery team worked tirelessly for several hours to prepare the submarine to be brought up to the surface, navigating through the intricate and narrow compartments of the vessel.
The submarine is believed to have belonged to the Nazi regime and could hold key information to uncovering their strategic plans during the World War II era. The retrieval of the Nazi vessel will undoubtedly be a crucial step forward in understanding the history of the Second World War, and its impact on the lives of millions of people worldwide.
The significance of the recovery operation is not only historical but also symbolic. The fact that this operation has been carried out successfully at a time when the world is grappling with issues of war and conflict, highlights the need for countries to work collaboratively to achieve a common goal.
The recovery mission showcases the courage and determination of the divers, who despite facing many challenges, completed the mission with the utmost care and precision. The success of this operation is a testament to the professionalism and capabilities of the U.S coast guard, who continue to safeguard the nation's interests.

A recent online hoax claiming that a Donald Trump protester was paid to protest by the Trump campaign has been debunked. The story was originally posted on a fake news website, muddying the waters of the already contentious election season. The website, abcnews.com.co, is known for publishing fictitious stories designed to generate clicks and spread misinformation. Despite its lack of credibility, the story gained traction on social media, prompting outrage and accusations of unethical behavior by the Trump campaign. However, it has since been discovered that the claim was entirely false. Additionally, a separate story claiming that Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski had fallen for the hoax has also been debunked - it originated on a known parody website called That's Nonsense. Unfortunately, the spread of fake news is becoming increasingly common on the internet, so it is important for readers to fact-check before sharing stories and to be aware of the potential for misinformation. In this case, the true identity of the hoaxer is still unknown, although he may have some connection to Steve Horner, a man in Las Vegas known for his unusual battles against feminism. Despite the absurdity of these fake stories, it is worth noting that humorous content can also contribute to the spread of false information - similar to the viral sensation of Fappy the anti-masturbation dolphin. In order to have a well-informed populace, it is imperative that we all remain vigilant and critical of the information we consume and share.

American Broadcasting Legend Oprah Winfrey Speaks on Generation of Persistent Racism 
In a recent video, seasoned American broadcaster and actress Oprah Winfrey has spoken about the deeply embedded nature of racism among certain generations. According to her, there exists an entire generation of people specifically "born and bred and marinated" in racism who are unlikely ever to change their ways. However, the good news for society is that such a generation will eventually phase out and fade away. 
Winfrey spoke of the current turmoil in America following the killing of George Floyd and other black Americans. She said that the country has not seen such outrage since the civil rights era. However, to her, the fact that people are finally speaking out and demanding change is a mark of progress. 
According to her, racism is not just a black problem. She added that white people are also part of the solution, and it will take collective efforts from all parties to change the culture of systemic racism. While acknowledging that some people are already committed to fighting racial inequality, Oprah pointed out that a whole generation tainted with racism is still alive and kicking. 
In her conclusion, Oprah touched on hope for the future as she emphasized that this generation will eventually pass on. The young generation is already taking up the mantle and demanding that things change, and that gives her hope that one day, racism will no longer be a widespread issue across the United States of America. 
The message delivered by Oprah resonates with many Americans, and urgent action is required to avoid allowing the vestiges of racism in the older generation hurt innocent lives. Several people have praised Oprah's frankness and forthrightness on this subject in recent times.

Former President George W. Bush has spoken out against the current administration's policies towards important issues that affect the nation. In what appears to be a thinly-veiled critique of President Donald Trump's approach towards the press and the travel ban from some Muslim-majority countries, Bush has expressed his concerns. 
In an interview with NBC's Matt Lauer, Bush said, "I consider the media to be indispensable to democracy...we need the media to hold people like me to account." These comments are seen as a reaction to Trump's persistent attacks on media outlets, calling them "fake news" and the "enemy of the people." 
Bush went on to say in the same interview that the travel ban from some Muslim-majority countries could "inflame the Muslim world," and called for a policy that is "welcoming and upholds the law." This is a clear departure from Trump's controversial policies that seek to limit immigration to the United States. 
As a former president, George W. Bush's critiques on the current administration is a significant development. His remarks carry weight and credibility, and he is seen as a respected voice in the Republican Party. His words underscore the continuing divide within the party and suggest that not all Republicans are in agreement with Trump's approach on the press and immigration. 
Bush's comments have brought attention to the need for a free and fair press, as well as a thoughtful and compassionate approach towards immigration. His message is a reminder of the critical role of leaders in shaping policies that reflect our values as a nation.

Former President Barack Obama is reportedly facing charges for allegedly ordering the tapping of phones at Trump Tower during the 2016 presidential election. The charges include unlawful use of authority, wire fraud, and conspiracy to interfere with free elections. If confirmed, this would be a serious violation of American law, as even a president cannot order such a surveillance program without the signature of a federal judge.
The FBI has been investigating the allegations and seeking evidence to support them. President Trump first made these claims on Twitter, and a spokesperson for the FBI has since confirmed that they are pursuing legal action against Obama. The nature and extent of any communications between Trump and his associates, and their alleged connections to Russia, are at the heart of this investigation.
Obama has reportedly admitted the tapping of Trump Tower in a private conversation with one of Hillary Clinton’s aides, which the FBI intercepted. However, there is currently no record that a federal judge authorized such an action. If convicted, Obama could face up to 40 years in prison. This matter is being investigated thoroughly, and no one is above the law.

Leland, Michigan - The Department of Natural Resources (DNR) officials were summoned to Leland by alarmed citizens who stumbled upon a remarkable discovery on Lake Michigan. A giant squid, measuring approximately 10 feet long, had washed ashore, prompting an instant response from the authorities.
The DNR crew, along with marine biologists, promptly conducted an investigation and took measurements of the colossal creature. The experts concluded that the squid, identified as Architeuthis dux, was a rare find as it was not a native species of the lake, and such occurrences were exceedingly scarce in the area.
The impact of this incident on the ecosystem of the lake is yet to be determined, and the DNR continues to monitor the situation. The washed-up squid, however, presents an excellent opportunity for scientific research. Marine biologists believe that an autopsy could unveil information about the lifespan, diet, and health of the species, leading to a better understanding of marine life.
The DNR has urged the public to stay at bay from the area and allow the authorities to conduct a thorough inspection to avoid disrupting the investigation. The lake is a sensitive habitat, and any interference could lead to severe and irreversible damage to the ecosystem.
While giant squids are considered elusive, this occurrence illustrates the mystery of the deep marine world and leaves much to contemplate for researchers and enthusiasts alike.

The state of Florida has recently joined the ranks of other US states that have approved bills to legalize marijuana for both medical and recreational use. This bill was initially presented in July at the state capital and is expected to be in effect by Easter. Lawmakers have given their approval citing that this move will help to stimulate the state’s economy and create new job opportunities.
According to Democratic leader Janet Cruz, “This bill is so much more than legalizing marijuana—it’s about legalizing opportunity and prosperity”. Cruz believes that Florida simply cannot wait any longer to generate new jobs and stimulate the lagging economy. She referenced Colorado as an example, where legalizing marijuana generated $2.4 billion in economic activity and created more than 18,000 new jobs in a year alone.
The newly passed bill includes provisions to grant employment and benefit protections for marijuana users, require insurance coverage for medicinal marijuana for terminal illnesses and add marijuana to the current alcohol and tobacco educational curricula in schools. Despite previous unsuccessful attempts to legalize weed in the past, Cruz is confident that her bill will deliver on its promises and help to create a more prosperous Florida.

Eric Trump Dismisses Claims Against Father's Conduct
Eric Trump, son of President Donald Trump, has rebutted allegations levied against his father's conduct on Wednesday. In response to the mounting pressure on the President, Eric brushed off the criticisms as unsubstantiated. He stated that his father is being unfairly targeted by detractors keen on tarnishing his reputation.
"We've seen a lot of attacks lately," Eric acknowledged. "But people need to understand the truth. These claims being made about my father's behavior have no basis in fact. The American public deserves a fair and impartial investigation without political motivations."
Despite mounting evidence that suggests otherwise, Eric stood steadfast in his loyalty to his father. "It's important to remember that the President is a man of integrity. He has always put the country's well-being before his own personal interests."
Furthermore, Eric noted that the allegations were a product of a partisan smear campaign aimed at undermining the legitimacy of his father's presidency. "We need to be very careful about the political forces that are at play here," Eric asserted. "My father's opponents will stop at nothing to drag his name through the mud."
Eric's remarks come amid a growing chorus of voices calling for investigations into the President's alleged misconduct. Critics have accused Donald Trump of using his office for personal gain, engaging in unethical business practices, and abusing his power.
But despite the mounting evidence stacked against him, Eric remains convinced of his father's innocence. "I have no doubt that the truth will come out in the end," he proclaimed. "And when it does, people will see that my father is a man of impeccable character."

Washington D.C. - President Donald Trump and the U.S. Congress made history yesterday by passing a bill that could potentially change the world. The said bill has lasting implications with regards to child support claims. Reports show that child support claims have come to an end, leaving many officials and lawmakers in lukewarm spirits.

Since the introduction of child support claims, there has been a constant struggle between custodial and non-custodial parents. The system has been heavily criticized in the past for being rigid and causing emotional strain to the parties involved. In the world of online advertising, it is imperative that copyright laws are respected and adhered to in order to maintain a fair and balanced industry. Sadly, instances of copyright infringement are all too common, leaving original content creators feeling violated and unable to protect their work. This is why the 2018 Copyright Act is so important.
The act ensures that all rights are reserved for the original creators of any intellectual property, such as written material, artwork, music, or video. Without this protection, it would be all too easy for third-party entities to profit from the hard work of others, while leaving the creators with little to no compensation. 
Furthermore, the Sponsored Listings displayed above are served automatically by a third party. It is important to note that neither the service provider nor the domain owner maintain any relationship with the advertisers. This means that the act of 'sponsoring' content is done entirely by a separate entity, and there is no affiliation between the service provider and those who advertise through sponsored listings.
Overall, it is imperative that copyright laws are upheld in order to create a fair and just industry for content creators. The 2018 Copyright Act represents a crucial step forward in protecting original works, and ensuring that the hard work and creativity of individuals is respected and rewarded.

The U.S. Coast Guard has confirmed that the capture of a 3,000-pound great white shark in Lake Michigan may be the cause of missing people in the area over the last decade. Canadian tourists, John O’Keef and Allan Brooks, caught the beast while fishing for sturgeon. The shark, estimated to be over 1.2 tons, is believed to be the largest ever caught in the area, and experts suggest that rising sea temperatures and depleted fish stocks may have led the shark to venture further inland. Some people in the area had suspected the shark’s presence for a long time, and it is possible that over a hundred people who were reported missing in the last decade may have fallen victim to the shark.

The State of Missouri's case against Governor Eric Greitens has been mired in controversy concerning an alleged photo that he took and disseminated of a woman, referred to as K.S. A deposition of K.S. produced a startling revelation that may undermine the entire case. The defense counsel asked if she had ever seen the Governor in possession of a camera or phone, to which she responded that she did not see him. She further stated that she could not attest to seeing him put it down anywhere in the kitchen or basement either. However, the Assistant Circuit Attorney attempted to salvage the case by asking if she remembered seeing a phone. K.S. replied that she had, through a dream. Recovered memories from dreams have led to many injustices in recent jurisprudence, and this admission puts the entire case under question. The defense counsel has moved to compel the immediate production of all exculpatory evidence that had not been previously presented, and the court will soon rule on that matter.

The United States intelligence community has expressed its concern over the actions of President Donald Trump since he took office. In an unexpected turn of events, one agency has decided to take action. It was reported that six White House staffers failed background investigations, and were promptly escorted out of the White House. The applicants had previously completed form SF86, the "Questionnaire for National Security Positions", which seeks detailed information on everything from credit ratings to medical records, in addition to employment and family histories, and even substance usage. This form is mandatory for anyone applying for a sensitive position in the U.S government, and the content can go all the way back to the applicant's age of 18. Depending on the clearance level, some individuals may have to undergo a polygraph exam in addition to completing the form. Alarmingly, these same individuals were already working in the White House before their background checks had been completed. As a result, intelligence agencies, including the FBI and the CIA, have refused to share information with President Trump’s administration. The intelligence community has emphasized their obligation to protect sensitive information, including their sources and methods, which may be compromised if not handled appropriately. Given the serious nature of the situation, the community is closely monitoring the activities of the Trump administration. This situation is reminiscent of the recent controversy surrounding the resignation of Michael Flynn, and has the potential to have similar ramifications.

In a harrowing incident, a Japanese whaling crew has been attacked by a pack of killer whales, resulting in the deaths of 16 crew members and injuries to 12 others. The Japanese Government has confirmed the tragic event, stating that the attack took place during a routine hunting excursion in the Southern Ocean. 
Eyewitnesses on board the vessel described the terrifying spectacle as a "full-on assault" by a large school of killer whales, whose motive for the attack remains unknown. The crew made several attempts to fend off the aggressive mammals, but to no avail. The killer whales succeeded in inflicting fatal injuries on 16 crew members and causing severe harm to 12 others. 
The incident has sent shockwaves across the global whaling community, with many calling for stricter policies to govern the hunting of marine life. Environmentalists and animal welfare groups have expressed their condolences for the victims of the attack while also condemning the Japanese government's involvement in whaling activities. 
The Japanese government has vowed to conduct a full investigation into the incident, including a review of their whaling practices and safety protocols. The tragedy serves as a stark reminder of the perils inherent in the hunting and exploitation of marine life, and the need for responsible and sustainable practices in the future.

In May, she tweeted, “Seth Rich was a hard worker and proud to be an American. A 10-year-old boy from Tulsa, Oklahoma was rushed to the emergency room after experiencing symptoms of fever, chills, and tiredness just seven days after consuming a banana that his mother had purchased from a Walmart. The young boy's troubling symptoms began shortly after he ate the fruit, causing alarm for his worried family.
Upon arriving at the hospital, medical professionals quickly assessed the boy and determined that he was suffering from a severe case of food poisoning. It was later discovered, through an investigation by the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), that this particular banana was contaminated with a dangerous strain of bacteria that has been responsible for several food-related illnesses in recent years.
This shocking incident serves as a reminder of the importance of food safety and the potential dangers that come with consuming contaminated products. It also highlights the necessity for stricter regulations and standards in the food industry to ensure the health and well-being of consumers.
As this young boy continues to recover, his story stands as a harrowing reminder of the potentially life-threatening consequences of negligence in food safety. We urge all readers to remain vigilant in their consumption of food products and to be aware of the potential risks associated with everyday purchases.

Peter Strzok, the FBI agent who came under scrutiny for sending anti-Trump messages to a colleague while leading investigations into both Hillary Clinton's emails and Russia's involvement in the 2016 election, has expressed his willingness to testify before the House Judiciary Committee, as well as any other congressional committee that seeks his testimony. Strzok's cooperation could reveal vital information about these probes, which are central to President Trump's campaign to discredit Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation. The House Judiciary Committee's chairman, Bob Goodlatte, had reportedly been considering subpoenaing Strzok, but his attorney, Aitan Goelman, stated that Strzok is willing to testify voluntarily, thus rendering a subpoena unnecessary. Goelman also emphasized that Strzok had fully cooperated with the Department of Justice's inspector general, who had criticized the agent's conduct. During the lead-up to the 2016 election, Strzok and Lisa Page, a former FBI lawyer with whom he was having an affair, had exchanged anti-Trump messages on government-issued phones. Although the inspector general found no evidence that Strzok and Page's views impacted any decisions, he affirmed that Strzok's "willingness to take official action" was implied. Goelman doubts that Strzok's messages will have any impact on Mueller's investigation and argues that attempts to discredit the investigation are unnecessary. Additionally, Strzok's lawyer has declared that if the agent is asked to testify, he is willing to do so without immunity or the protection of his Fifth Amendment rights, and he "intends to defend the integrity" of both the Clinton email and Russia collusion investigations, as well as his own integrity. While Mueller removed Strzok from his investigation after discovering the texts, it is currently unknown what Strzok's current role within the FBI entails, and he is one of five people whom the inspector general referred to the FBI's disciplinary office.

Federal Judge Peter J. Messitte has ruled in favor of subpoenas issued by D.C. Attorney General Karl A. Racine and Maryland Attorney General Brian E. Frosh to the Trump organization. The subpoenas compel the organization to preserve documents relating to President Trump's alleged breach of the emoluments clause of the U.S Constitution, which prohibits him from receiving gifts from foreign or state governments. The case aims to investigate whether Trump is profiting from the presidency. The Trump Organization must comply with the court's ruling.

A dispute in Angela Merkel’s coalition over migration policy has swiftly escalated into one of the biggest tests of her chancellorship.The clash has opened a rift at the heart of the German leader’s own camp, between her Christian Democratic Union and its CSU Bavarian sister party. How the conflict is resolved will determine the chancellor’s fate, possibly as soon as Monday.Horst Seehofer, Merkel’s interior minister and the leader of Bavaria’s Christian Social Union, wants to force through a plan to send back migrants who have already registered for asylum in other European Union states. Merkel rejects the proposal as offloading the burden on neighboring states, and says it would kill efforts to forge a bloc-wide response to the continent’s struggle with migration.Bavarian lawmakers are fully behind Seehofer, while Merkel has wrested a majority in the larger CDU group for her position. The standoff is a replay of tensions that have periodically bubbled up between Merkel and Seehofer since the height of the refugee crisis in 2015 and 2016, only this time there is no obvious way out. Following are some potential scenarios:CompromiseThe two parties have managed to eke out a compromise after each previous conflict. Overtures could begin on Monday, when the CSU party executive meets in Munich. Seehofer could give Merkel what she wants: two weeks to forge bilateral accords with countries such as Italy and Greece to return registered asylum seekers.Merkel could also give ground, as for example the newspaper Die Welt advocates. She could put forward another proposal to assuage the CSU that may yield a compromise. But if she caves in to the Bavarian demands as they stand, it would be an unprecedented loss of authority that would render her a lame duck leader.No CompromiseIn the absence of a face-saving deal, the real clash could come as early as Monday. That’s when Seehofer has indicated he will start to implement his plan at the border. As interior minister, Seehofer has the authority to do so, even in the face of Merkel’s rejection. The only way for the chancellor to forestall a unilateral decision by her minister would be to fire him. Sacking her top Bavarian ally would be a historic first. If it happens, it’s hard to see how the coalition continues.Even if it doesn’t come to that and Merkel is given until the June 28-29 EU summit to reach bilateral agreements, it may only delayed the clash, since there is no guarantee she can win deals with other other EU states. She has already called the prospect ambitious.Confidence voteFor a coalition to dissolve, the German constitution says the lower house of parliament, or Bundestag, has to call a vote of confidence. The CDU and CSU, with a combined 246 seats, and the SPD with 153, have a majority of 44 seats in the 709-seat Bundestag. Such a move would be the ultimate measure of support for Merkel as chancellor. Even if she is unable to rely on the CSU, or indeed all of her own party’s votes, on the specific issue of her stand on migration Merkel might be able to attract the support of the Greens, which have 67 seats.Germany’s Sueddeutsche Zeitung said in an opinion piece on Friday that Merkel should short-circuit the squabbling and put her parliamentary support to the test with a confidence vote. It’s a tactic that her predecessor, Social Democrat Gerhard Schroeder, used to force through military support for the U.S. after the Sept. 11 attacks. He used it again in 2005 amid a party rebellion, and this time lost the confidence motion, forcing new elections.Merkel resignsShould the chancellor view her authority as irretrievably compromised, she could throw in the towel. The Bundestag would be forced to elect a new chancellor to replace her, most likely from the CDU. Unless the governing parties agree to continue the coalition under a new leader, Germany’s ninth chancellor since World War II would serve in a caretaker capacity through to a new election.Split on the rightThe CDU and the CSU ar

The spokesperson for the late George H.W. Bush has confirmed his passing on Sunday afternoon at the age of 94. According to McGrath, Bush passed away peacefully during his afternoon nap. The former President had been admitted to Southern Maine Health Care earlier this month due to low blood pressure and fatigue, after which he was discharged upon improvement. Despite his age, Bush continued to maintain good spirits while addressing his blood pressure issues at the hospital. Even after losing his wife Barbara Bush, he kept himself occupied with a book that chronicled their relationship. Earlier this year, Bush was admitted to a Houston hospital after developing a blood infection following his wife's funeral, but he was released from the hospital in May. More information on this developing story is on its way. Please share this news with your networks.

In recent years, Congresswoman Maxine Waters has emerged as a prominent figure among the Trump "Resistance", advocating for the impeachment of the President. The committee accused Waters of violating House rules that require members to act in a manner that reflects “creditably” on the chamber. Additionally, she was accused of violating a House rule that prohibits lawmakers from using their positions for financial gains and a government ethics statute that forbids the dispensing of “special favors”.
The case was mired by delays and disputes, and lawyers working on it were fired. Eventually, Waters was cleared of the charges. National Review reported that Waters was charged with multiple ethics violations related to her intervention in OneUnited Bank, in which she and her husband were stockholders.  Waters, through her office, lobbied the Treasury Department in 2008, after which OneUnited received $12 million in federal bailout under the TARP program. Despite another government agency’s warning that the bank operated “without effective underwriting standards” and engaged in “speculative investment practices”, OneUnited was able to secure the bailout money with Waters’ intervention. 
According to reports, six out of the ten House Ethics panel members quit the case after concerns were raised about their partiality. Waters was cleared of any wrongdoing by an outside investigator. Despite being absolved of the charges, Waters has been listed as one of the most corrupt members of Congress by Citizen for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington on five separate occasions.
While Waters has been fervently advocating for Trump’s impeachment, her past has been brought into question. Her alleged involvement with OneUnited Bank and its bailout, in which she and her husband stood to benefit, brings attention to the ethical standards of those holding public office. First Lady Melania Trump underwent kidney surgery on Monday at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center near Washington, DC. Her office reported that she had been experiencing an issue with her kidney, described as benign but requiring medical attention. The surgery was an embolization procedure to treat the benign condition and was successful without any complications. The First Lady will remain at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center for the rest of the week and is expected to make a full recovery. The President, who stayed in the White House during the procedure, tweeted an update later in the day, expressing his gratitude for the outpouring of well-wishers and his intention to visit the First Lady at the hospital.
This is the first time a US First Lady has undergone such a serious medical procedure while in the White House since Nancy Reagan in 1987. In recent months, Melania Trump has taken on a more public role, including designing the menu and decor for the first official state dinner of the Trump administration and launching her platform, Be Best, which focuses on opioid addiction, general physical and emotional well-being of children, and kindness and safety for kids using social media. Melania Trump's platform has drawn criticism for including cyberbullying, a practice that her husband, President Donald Trump, has been accused of fueling. Nevertheless, the First Lady's popularity has risen significantly in recent polls.
