Emily Olivia Leah Blunt (born 23 February 1983)[3] is a British-American actress.[4] She is the recipient of several accolades, including one Golden Globe Award and has been nominated for two competitive British Academy Film Awards. Educated in the performing arts at the Hurtwood House in Dorking, Blunt made her acting debut in a 2001 stage production of The Royal Family. She went on to appear in the television film Boudica and portrayed the ill-fated queen consort Catherine Howard in the miniseries Henry VIII (both 2003), following which she made her feature film debut in the 2004 drama My Summer of Love. Blunt's breakthrough came in 2006 when she starred in the television film Gideon's Daughter and the highly successful American comedy film The Devil Wears Prada. The former won her a Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress and the latter earned her a nomination for the BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role. Blunt's profile continued to expand as she took on leading roles in the period film The Young Victoria (2009), the romantic comedy Salmon Fishing in the Yemen (2011), the science fiction films The Adjustment Bureau (2011), Looper (2012), and Edge of Tomorrow (2014), and the musical fantasy Into the Woods (2014). She was praised for playing a principled FBI agent in the crime film Sicario (2015) and an alcoholic woman in the thriller The Girl on the Train (2016); for the latter she received nominations for the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role and the BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Leading Role. In 2018, Blunt starred alongside her husband, John Krasinski, in the acclaimed horror film A Quiet Place, and will next star as Mary Poppins in the musical fantasy film Mary Poppins Returns. Early life [ edit ] Blunt was born in Wandsworth, London.[5][6] She is the second of four children[7] born to Joanna, a former actress and teacher,[8][9] and barrister Oliver Simon Peter Blunt, QC.[10][11][12] Her siblings are Felicity, Sebastian, and Susannah.[10][13] Her grandfather was Major-General Peter Blunt, and one of her paternal uncles is Crispin Blunt,[14] Conservative Member of Parliament for Reigate. From the age of seven to 14, Blunt struggled with stuttering.[15] She credits a school teacher for helping her overcome the stutter through acting.[16] She went on to sit on the board of directors for the American Institute for Stuttering.[17] Blunt attended Ibstock Place School in Roehampton, southwest London and, at the age of 16, went to Hurtwood House in Dorking, Surrey, a private sixth-form college known for its performing arts programme. There, she was discovered and signed by an agent.[18][not in citation given] Career [ edit ] 2001–2004: Career beginnings [ edit ] In November 2001, Blunt made her professional debut opposite Dame Judi Dench in Sir Peter Hall's production of the play The Royal Family, in which she played the role of the granddaughter Gwen to Dench's Fanny Cavendish. Critic Tom Keatinge hailed the production, writing that "Peter Hall's direction and Anthony Ward's tremendous set combine with all this to make The Royal Family a terrific night's entertainment", and that "it provides a vehicle for acting of the finest quality, with strong performances from the whole ensemble".[19] For her performance, Blunt was named "Best Newcomer" by the Evening Standard. She went on to perform as Eugenie in Nicholas Wright's Vincent in Brixton at the National Theatre, and as Juliet in Indhu Rubasingham's production of Romeo and Juliet at Chichester Festival Theatre, both in 2002.[18] In 2003, Blunt made her screen debut in the British television drama Boudica, about the life of the ancient Celtic warrior-queen who fought the Romans. That same year, she was praised for her performance as the 16th-century queen Catherine Howard in the two-part British television drama Henry VIII.[18] In 2004, Blunt received considerable attention for her performance as Tam

Title: Serena Williams Refutes John McEnroe's Claims, Asserts her Dominance in Tennis
In a recent development, tennis superstar Serena Williams has strongly rebutted controversial claims made by John McEnroe, the arguably legendary male tennis player, regarding her hypothetical performance on the men's circuit. Williams, who holds an unprecedented record of 23 Grand Slam singles titles, voiced her disagreement over McEnroe's statements, categorically refuting any doubts surrounding her ability to compete at the highest level of men's tennis.
McEnroe's comments, made during an interview on a popular television show, ignited a fervent debate within the tennis community. The Hall of Famer and former world number one argued that if Williams were competing against men, she would find it difficult to break into the top 700. However, Williams, undoubtedly one of the greatest athletes of our time, has responded with unwavering determination, asserting her confidence and maintaining her belief that she would emerge victorious against even the toughest male competition.
In a recent press conference following McEnroe's remarks, Serena Williams expressed her disappointment and surprise at his assertions. She firmly stated, "I would hope that I would win against Serena", dismissing McEnroe's hypothetical claim as purely speculative. Williams, known for her resilience and mental fortitude, further emphasized that she has always been fueled by challenges, and the suggestion that she would struggle against male opponents only fuels her drive to prove the naysayers wrong.
With a career marked by unparalleled success, Williams has shattered numerous records and changed the face of women's tennis forever. Her unwavering dedication, extraordinary skill, and immense physical prowess have been instrumental in establishing her dominance in the sport. Not only does Williams boast an astonishing 23 Grand Slam titles, but she has also proven her mettle against past and current tennis greats.
Exemplifying her undeniable prowess, Williams has defeated several male tennis players during exhibition matches over the years. These victories have served as compelling evidence of her ability to compete at the highest level of professional tennis, irrespective of her opponents' gender. Arguably, such triumphs have demonstrated the significance of Williams' contributions in transcending the limits of gender in the realm of sports.
Williams' crusade for gender equality in tennis has not only inspired countless aspiring female athletes but has also ensured that her legacy will be immortalized in the annals of sporting history. Over the years, she has confronted arduous challenges, both on and off the court, with an unwavering spirit and an unwritten determination to overcome any odds stacked against her.
As the tennis world continues to grapple with the controversy ignited by John McEnroe's comments, Serena Williams' swift and vehement response sends a resounding message. It underscores her resolute belief in her abilities, reinforcing the notion that gender need not be a restrictive factor in determining athletic prowess.
While it is true that Serena Williams would face a unique set of challenges on the men's circuit, to discredit her capability is to undermine her monumental achievements and her enduring legacy. As a beacon of inspiration to aspiring athletes worldwide, Williams has unassailably cemented her place among the greatest tennis players of all time.

Two arrests have been made in connection to the murders of four women at Fairmont Terrace Apartments last month, police announced in a press conference on Wednesday afternoon. Brothers James Stanford Poore, aged 32, and Cedric Dwayne Poore, aged 39, were apprehended and charged with four counts each of first-degree murder, according to Chief Chuck Jordan.
The victims, twin sisters Rebeika Powell and Kayetie Powell-Melchor (23 years old), Misty Nunley (33 years old), and Julie Jackson (55 years old), were tragically found with gunshot wounds to the head, their hands bound behind their backs inside a south Tulsa apartment. A three-year-old boy, who was also found in the apartment, was unharmed.
Chief Jordan stated that the motive behind these horrifying murders was not related to any gang activity. Information gathered from witnesses revealed that the suspects left their own apartment in the same building as Fairmont Terrace Apartments, situated near 61st and Peoria, with the intention of carrying out a criminal act at the victims' residence. Approximately 20 minutes later, the witnesses reported seeing the brothers return with a bag containing drugs, cash, and jewelry. One witness informed investigators that James Poore shared his motivation for shooting one of the victims, fearing she could recognize him, while Cedric Poore was responsible for shooting the other three victims. The witnesses further disclosed that the brothers divided the stolen money between them, with Cedric Poore pawning the stolen jewelry.
During the interview on Wednesday, James Poore admitted to investigators that he knew one of the victims and was present at the apartment complex at the time specified by the witnesses. He also provided the information that one of the victims had a history of using and selling illegal drugs, and described how Cedric had arrived at the apartment that day driving a black van. Shortly after making these statements, James Poore invoked his right to remain silent. In contrast, Cedric Poore denied being present in the apartment on the day of the murders and declined any further communication with investigators.
Chief Jordan revealed that both brothers were residents of Fairmont Terrace Apartments. However, the property manager confirmed that neither of them were on the lease agreement. Cedric Poore had been confined in Tulsa County jail since January 14 for a traffic violation, while James Poore was apprehended on Wednesday morning. Records from the Department of Corrections indicate that both brothers had been previously incarcerated for armed robbery.
Chief Jordan concluded the press conference by mentioning the possibility of additional arrests in connection with this case. Mayor Dewey Bartlett also released a statement in response to the news of the arrests, commending the Tulsa Police Department for their swift action. He expressed his unwavering faith in Chief Chuck Jordan and the entire police force, highlighting the importance of public assistance in solving such heinous crimes.

The couple's confirmation comes after months of speculation, fueled in part by a Calvin Klein campaign featuring all the Kardashian sisters, which heavily implied Kylie's pregnancy. In the video, Kylie and Travis are seen together, showcasing their love and support for each other throughout her pregnancy. Despite rumors of a split between the two, the footage demonstrates their happiness and togetherness, even capturing the joyous moment of the baby's birth. Prior to the announcement, fans eagerly awaited any signs of Kylie's pregnancy, with some spotting a potential baby bump in old photos and videos. The Kardashian Christmas card, released over the course of 24 days, also fueled speculation, as fans believed that the final reveal on Christmas Day would feature Kylie and her baby. However, she was absent from the card, leaving fans convinced that she was heavily pregnant. Kris Jenner, Kylie's mother, further added to the speculation during a Christmas special of Keeping Up With The Kardashians, expressing her gratitude for her growing family. Photos obtained by The Sun showed evidence of a pink-themed baby shower at Kylie's LA mansion, suggesting that she is expecting a baby girl. Additionally, fans have pointed to a tweet by Travis Scott in June, in which he declared it the "happiest day" of his life, coinciding with the reported due date. People magazine originally reported that Kylie was due to give birth in February, with sources confirming that she and Travis were thrilled about the unexpected news. Despite not confirming or denying her pregnancy, rumors have already begun circulating about the unique name Kylie will choose for her baby.

Regardless of any preconceived notions about Keeping Up With The Kardashians, the long-running and popular show delves into some deeply emotional storylines. Beyond the surface-level focus on technology, healthy eating, and colloquial language, there are truly moving moments to be found.
Consider Kim's account of the terrifying ordeal she experienced in Paris, or Khloe's concerns about her fertility. The dysfunctional relationship between Scott and Courtney is also undeniably unsettling. It seems that shedding a tear for the Kardashians is not an uncommon occurrence, as revealed in their celebratory cover story with the Hollywood Reporter. Kendall explained that even the crew members can't help but be moved to tears when one of the girls opens up.
The personal connection between the family and their crew is undeniable. Kendall acknowledges the intimate relationship they share, stating that when someone cries on the show, it often prompts tears from the camera operators and producers as well. Kim reinforces this sentiment, emphasizing that these crew members witness every detail of their lives. The crew size can vary, ranging from a single person with an iPhone to a team of 30 individuals, all diligently observing their every move.
Anyone present on set during Kendall's controversial Pepsi advertisement would have also been privy to her reaction amidst the criticism she faced. While the public has not been provided with evidence of how Kendall responded to the backlash (as she deleted all related content from her social media and never made an official statement), Kim sheds some light on the situation. According to Kim, Kendall never allowed herself to be shown crying on camera. Despite the inner turmoil she experienced, Kendall made a conscious decision to appear resilient in the media. Kim, however, believed that Kendall should have spoken up, viewing the situation as unjust.
Ultimately, it appears that the only individuals who truly know the extent of Kendall's emotions during that time are the crew members who witnessed it firsthand.

Donald Trump will be sworn in as the 45th president of the United States on Friday, but not everyone will be tuning in. In this unprecedented political climate, the nation remains divided, and the impending inauguration does not escape the deep polarization that continues to grip the country.
As the fire of political discourse rages on, dissenting voices who refuse to participate in this historic event are growing in numbers. It is important to acknowledge that many citizens, disenchanted with the path President-elect Trump has charted, have made the conscious decision to abstain from witnessing the inauguration ceremony.
The decision by some Americans to forego witnessing this momentous occasion, which has typically served as a symbol of unity and hope for the future, reflects the deep-seated concerns felt by a significant portion of the population. These concerns largely stem from the controversies and various policy stances that have characterized Trump's unconventional campaign and transition.
It is worth noting that this resistance is not solely confined to the general public. Numerous elected officials, both at the federal and state levels, have signaled their intent to skip the inauguration festivities. Many express their refusal as an act of solidarity with constituents who feel marginalized by Trump's rhetoric, policies, or actions. It is evident that controversy continues to follow the president-elect, even as he prepares to take the oath of office.
Nevertheless, the momentous nature of the inauguration cannot be overlooked. With the presidential seal adorning his lectern, Donald Trump will be entrusted with the responsibility of leading the United States through some of its most complex challenges. Millions of Americans, both ardent supporters and skeptical observers, recognize the significance of this day and will be tuned in to witness the transfer of power.
As the clock ticks down to Friday's inauguration, it is important to reflect on the broader implications of this event. This is not merely an inauguration; it signifies the beginning of a new chapter in America's storied history. The world watches with bated breath as the United States, a global superpower, transitions power to the 45th president.
Whether Americans choose to watch or abstain from the inauguration, it is the hope of many that unity, mutual respect, and progress will prevail during Trump's tenure. The challenges facing our divided nation are monumental, but together, through perseverance and dialogue, there is immense potential to build a stronger, more inclusive society.
So, as Donald J. Trump steps onto the grand stage on January 20th to usher in a new era, it is clear that not everyone will be watching. Yet, in the midst of this historic occasion, one can only hope that the United States can find common ground, bridging the vast divides that have plagued our nation, and forge a path forward that benefits all its citizens.

If you happen to witness a gathering of people lining up outside Harry Styles's residence today, it is possible that the renowned One Direction singer is seeking solace after his reported breakup with girlfriend Tess Ward. Allow us to inform you of the recent development regarding their relationship. According to The Sun, Tess, a well-known blogger and chef, recently decided to end things with Harry due to lingering feelings for her previous partner. The reason for this decision was not taken lightly. 
An undisclosed source revealed, "Harry and Tess have been unable to meet in person for several weeks as both are constantly on the move, traveling the world. Tess also came to realize that she still harbored emotions for her ex-partner, which she sincerely admitted to Harry, expressing regret for her romantic involvement with the singer. Rebuilding trust will undoubtedly take time, but they continue to maintain a normal relationship. Just this week, Tess was in London and immediately met her ex-partner, after which they have been inseparable."
Though the situation is undoubtedly distressing for Harry, it is possible that a new stylish shirt or a striking pair of boots may help lift his spirits. 
The connection between Harry and Tess initially emerged last month when an insider divulged to The Sun that they were introduced through mutual friends. Harry was reportedly taken with Tess almost immediately. "Once Harry met Tess, there was an immediate spark between them," the source revealed. "Their shared interests in unique fashion and culinary delights deepened their connection, and romance blossomed quickly. While Harry has been in London, they have been on several dates, and Tess has already met some of his close friends, including his personal stylist Lou Teasdale. This relationship seems distinguishable from Harry's previous experiences, as he truly adores Tess and is determined not to let this opportunity slip away."
Our hearts go out to Harry during this challenging time. Should he desire the comfort of watching Bridget Jones's Diary and indulging in Ben & Jerry's ice cream, he can rest assured that there is unwavering support available.

Jennifer Hudson, the former star of 'Dream Girl,' is reportedly causing chaos for NBC's The Voice. As the 36-year-old singer competes against coaches Miley Cyrus, Adam Levine, and Blake Shelton on season 13, sources reveal that she is also engaged in a battle with her superiors after being informed that she is not welcome back. According to a production insider, NBC executives have requested that Hudson stop using The Voice as a platform to promote her own production company, JHud Productions. However, Hudson has publicly defied these orders by posting an Instagram photo advertising her company while seated in her judges chair. The source claims that there is a great deal of drama behind the scenes, with Hudson being described as a difficult person to work with. The insider also reveals that Miley Cyrus and Blake Shelton often speak poorly of her behind her back, which Hudson is well aware of. Despite all this, Hudson maintains a low profile when the cameras are not rolling.

Lady Gaga, the renowned pop icon and Grammy award-winning artist, has announced the release of an intimate and revealing documentary that delves into her personal battles with chronic pain and the debilitating condition of fibromyalgia. In an effort to shed light on the often misunderstood world of chronic illness, Gaga courageously opens up about her hardships and shares her journey towards acceptance.
The forthcoming documentary, set to captivate audiences worldwide, chronicles the multifaceted aspects of Lady Gaga's life through an uncompromising lens. Directed by Chris Moukarbel, acclaimed for his previous work chronicling the lives of iconic artists, this project promises to provide a poignant and unfiltered exploration of the pop sensation's struggles with chronic pain and her relentless pursuit of artistic expression.
Gaga's decision to address her medical condition head-on comes as no surprise to those who have followed her astounding career closely. In recent years, the artist has been candid about the challenges she faces due to chronic pain, causing her to cancel performances and withdraw from public appearances. However, she has always remained an unwavering advocate for mental health awareness, urging fans and fellow artists alike to embrace compassion and empathy towards those facing invisible battles.
Fibromyalgia, a chronic disorder that affects millions of individuals worldwide, is characterized by relentless pain, fatigue, and enduring muscle stiffness. The release of this documentary marks an unprecedented moment in both Gaga's career and the broader conversation surrounding chronic illness. By sharing her story, she aims to not only offer solace to those experiencing similar challenges but also to foster greater understanding and empathy among society at large.
Throughout the documentary, Gaga examines the intertwined relationship between her medical condition and the relentless pursuit of her creative passion. From the grandeur of her jaw-dropping live performances to the intimate moments spent in pain and vulnerability, the film provides an unmasked portrayal of the artist, allowing viewers to witness the indomitable spirit that fuels her artistry.
By shedding light on the unseen battles fought beneath the glitz and glamour of superstardom, Lady Gaga hopes to spark a much-needed dialogue about the impact of chronic illness on individuals and their communities. Beyond inspiring her dedicated fanbase, fondly referred to as the Little Monsters, Gaga's documentary holds the potential to reshape societal perceptions of chronic pain and bring forth a new era of compassion, understanding, and inclusivity.
As anticipation mounts for the premiere of this ground-breaking documentary, both Lady Gaga's fans and the wider public eagerly await the opportunity to gain deeper insight into the life of a cultural icon, one who is willing to confront her own personal struggles in the hope of fostering genuine empathy and acceptance in our society.

Absurdly Driven, a column on business that takes a skeptical yet lighthearted approach, explores how people often make unflattering comments about others, including public figures like the Pope. These comments can only affect the person if they hear about them or if they are directly confronted with them. Social media platforms like Twitter provide the perfect outlet for people to anonymously and freely insult others. Kim Kardashian, a popular target for criticism, recently received a wry comment about her self-absorption on Twitter. Instead of responding aggressively or ignoring it, Kardashian chose to disarmingly agree with the commenter, showcasing her sense of self-awareness. This unexpected response not only defused the situation but also garnered a contrite response from the commenter. Kardashian's ability to turn a potentially hurtful situation into laughter demonstrates her skill in handling such encounters.

Blake Shelton attributes his recovery from his divorce with Miranda Lambert to the support and understanding of Gwen Stefani. In a recent interview with Billboard magazine, the country superstar opened up about his relationship with the No Doubt frontwoman. During a meeting with their colleagues on The Voice, Shelton broke the news to Stefani about his split with Lambert. Despite not knowing each other well at the time, Stefani showed genuine empathy, shedding tears as she expressed her own experiences of going through a similar situation. At the same time, Stefani was also dealing with her own breakup from Gavin Rossdale, who had cheated on her with their children's nanny. The two musicians found solace in each other's company, gradually building a strong bond of friendship and support. As their connection grew deeper, Shelton began to see Stefani in a new light. Their friendship evolved from occasional emails to more frequent check-ins and eventually daily communication. Shelton admitted that Stefani had become his top priority and he wondered if his feelings were reciprocated. Shelton expressed his gratitude to Stefani, acknowledging that she saved him during this challenging period of his life. The understanding and shared experiences they both had as musicians going through high-profile divorces were unparalleled. Not only did they rely on each other for emotional support, but they also collaborated on a song, "Go Ahead and Break My Heart," which Shelton included on his album If I'm Honest. Shelton confessed that their recording sessions occurred just six months after his divorce, when he was at his lowest point and in desperate need of catharsis. Overall, Shelton's heartfelt recounting of Stefani's impact on his life stands as a testament to the transformative power of friendship and understanding during times of adversity.

Anna Wintour, the current editor in chief of Vogue magazine, possesses a fortune of $35 million. Apart from her wealth, she holds a highly esteemed position in the realm of magazine publishing. Furthermore, she served as the somewhat unflattering inspiration for the renowned novel and film The Devil Wears Prada. Wintour's career commenced in the fashion industry before transitioning into journalism, primarily due to her parents' influence. In 1970, she was employed as an editorial assistant for the newly established Harper's & Queen fashion magazine. Even in the early stages of her professional journey, Wintour confided in her colleagues about her ambition to edit Vogue, a long-cherished aspiration that came to fruition nearly two decades later. Wintour implemented significant transformations to Vogue right from her inaugural issue, with numerous noticeable alterations evident on the cover. She preferred more naturalistic photography featuring unfamiliar models in outdoor settings, departing from the previous preference for close-up headshots. Notably, Wintour's premier Vogue cover was groundbreaking as it showcased a model sporting jeans, accompanied by an embellished T-shirt valued at approximately $10,000. Under Wintour's leadership, Vogue has consistently maintained its influential status in the field of fashion journalism.

Maksim Chmerkovskiy garnered attention when he opted out of taking part in Dancing with the Stars earlier this season, amidst rumors of a strained relationship with partner Vanessa Lachey. Social media platforms, particularly Twitter, have not allowed the dancing duo to escape the spotlight. Following their Snow White-themed performance on Disney Night this Monday, fans of the ABC reality dance competition began expressing their thoughts on the chemistry between the two. Some fans noted the palpable tension between Maks and Vanessa, even suggesting that it could be "cut with a knife." This sentiment, however, did not reflect the warm and affectionate dynamic observed between Chmerkovskiy, 37, and Lachey, 36, behind the scenes during the live show. During the commercial break before their performance, Lachey and Chmerkovskiy took the opportunity to interact with Lachey's two older children, who were seated in the front row. Chmerkovskiy then guided Lachey to the center of the ballroom to rehearse their routine. After rehearsing, Lachey returned to her children while Chmerkovskiy playfully joined her moments later, eliciting laughter from Lachey. Once the show resumed after the advertisements, they assumed their positions. Even after receiving their scores of 24 out of 30, fans continued to remark on their demeanor, perceiving it as uncomfortable. However, behind the scenes, Chmerkovskiy was seen comforting Lachey, who appeared to have hoped for higher scores. This gave credence to the rumors circulating about their strained relationship. Despite tension in the rehearsal room, sources divulged to PEOPLE that during Monday's emotionally charged elimination, Lachey sought solace in Chmerkovskiy's arms. This occurred when it was announced that her husband, Nick Lachey, was not in danger of being eliminated for the first time in three weeks. Chmerkovskiy embraced her and provided support until the entire cast came together to bid farewell to Gleb Savchenko and Sasha Pieterse. Chmerkovskiy and Lachey will return to the ballroom on Monday (8 p.m. ET) for Movie Night on the ABC reality dance competition.

Kris, 61, and 36-year-old Corey haven’t been seen together in public since Valentine’s Day - and even then they hardly looked loved up.  ‘Corey was traipsing around behind Kris holding her handbag. It was like she barely registered he was there,’ says an eyewitness who spotted them out in LA.  In a blow to Kris’ ego, it’s believed that Corey, Justin Bieber’s former road manager, initiated their break-up.  ‘She had been nagging him about a number of things for a while, including the fact that he wasn’t spending as much time with her as she’d like, and he just couldn’t take it anymore,' says Star’s source, who adds that Kris is devastated.  ‘She can’t stand to be alone. But I suspect she and Corey may have actually put on a united front in public for some time, since ratings have been way down for Keeping Up With The Kardashians. Kris is obsessed with maintaining the impression that everything is wonderful.

Title: Jennifer Lopez Embraces Patience as a Lifelong Commitment Takes Precedence Over Hasty Nuptials with Alex Rodriguez
Date: [Current Date]
Amidst swirling rumors circulating about the future of Jennifer Lopez and Alex Rodriguez's relationship, the internationally acclaimed actress and singer has made it clear that while she may not be in a hurry to walk down the aisle, she indeed envisions spending the rest of her life with a cherished partner. Displaying a profound sense of patience in matters of the heart, Lopez's admirable resolve prompts us to pause and contemplate the importance of forging a lifelong connection, unburdened by the pressures of societal expectations.
Refusing to succumb to the societal pressures of rushing into matrimony, the multifaceted Lopez emphasizes the value of taking time to nurture a deep emotional bond, one that transcends the superficial expectations often associated with celebrity relationships. Rather than succumbing to the impulsive nature of their highly publicized romance, Jennifer Lopez embraces the notion that the journey towards eternal commitment deserves thoughtful consideration and a deliberate path.
Lopez, an individual who has repeatedly demonstrated her tenacity, ambition, and firm grasp on her own identity, resonates with many in her decision to refrain from hastened vows. Her approach represents a vital reminder of the importance of remaining true to oneself while navigating the complexities inherent in forging a lifelong partnership.
Taking a holistic and measured approach to matters of the heart, Jennifer Lopez perpetuates the belief that one must not rush into matrimony without due consideration. In an era where social media trends and societal pressures constantly dictate one's life choices, her message serves as a beacon of hope for those seeking lasting commitment amidst an overtly fleeting and disposable landscape.
Radical transformation and permanent growth seem to be the guiding principles Jennifer Lopez internalizes throughout her personal journey. Her decision to eschew societal expectations reflects a profound understanding that a lasting partnership transcends the need to conform to external demands. Consequently, the renowned performer encourages us to ponder the essentiality of building a foundation based on emotional connection, shared values, and profound understanding before embarking on the formal union of marriage.
As the world remains captivated by the sensational allure of celebrity romances, Jennifer Lopez stands out as a resolute figure, ardently prioritizing the pursuit of a genuine connection built on mutually shared love and understanding. By demonstrating unwavering commitment to the journey towards lifelong companionship, she affirms that true love is a quest to be savored, devoid of haste or external expectations.
While the wedding bells may not ring in the immediate future, Jennifer Lopez symbolizes an inspirational archetype of patience, authenticity, and unwavering belief in true love's transformative power. Her spirit serves as a gentle reminder that the path to lasting bliss lies not in the rush down the aisle but in the tireless cultivation of a profound emotional bond, preparing the foundation for a lifetime of happiness and fulfillment.

The National Association of Black Journalists has expressed its concern over the recent departure of Tamron Hall from NBC, accusing the network of "whitewashing". In a statement on their website, the organization explained that Hall had made history as the first black female cohost on the "Today Show", and that she had achieved great success in ratings alongside Al Roker during the show's third hour. While NBC has been praised for its commitment to diversity in broadcasting, the decision to replace Hall and Roker with former Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly has raised eyebrows in the industry. NBC responded to the accusation by highlighting their long-standing commitment to newsroom diversity, reiterating their willingness to engage with advocacy groups such as the National Association of Black Journalists to advance these goals. Earlier this week, NBC announced that Hall would be leaving the network, expressing their disappointment in her decision but also wishing her well. Hall's departure came as a surprise to many, as she was informed just minutes before going on air that she and Roker would be replaced by Kelly. Despite this, Hall remained grateful for the opportunities she had at NBC and expressed excitement for the future.

Daniel Craig is returning as James Bond once again, even as he reportedly fights to save his marriage to Rachel Weisz at the same time. Craig has already announced his intent to return as 007 in the franchise’s 25th film, and according to the National Enquirer, he’s still struggling to salvage what’s left of his marriage.  The Enquirer’s source claimed at the beginning of 2017, “Rachel and Daniel haven’t been happy for a while, and nearly called it quits last year.” The report claims that the married couple was in two separate filming locations at the beginning of the year, but continued to stay apart even after wrapping their respective films. The Enquirer then claims that they finally reunited in July after not being seen together in ‘554 days’.  According to the sources, the minute the outlet attempted to lock down an exclusive on the couple’s rocky marriage, both Rachel Weisz and Daniel Craig were seen arriving at New York’s Public Theater the next day, prompting the source to add, “The whole thing just seemed like too much of a coincidence. I don’t buy it for a minute.”  When you consider Daniel Craig’s own words, especially in the context of allegedly turning down a $150 million payday to star in two more James Bond films, he had stated, “Being on your own would be sad, sick, and weird. I don’t trust myself. I need that balance.” If these reports are to be believed, then Daniel Craig previously turned down starring in more Bond films to spend time with his family, but now – all of a sudden – he’s back to working on James Bond?  Either the report was never accurate to begin with, or he’s giving up on his marriage to Rachel Weisz. One would hope that the two have worked out whatever was troubling them in the first place, but given their own relationship and marriage histories – and how they’ve both jumped ship on long-term relationships at the drop of a hat – one wouldn’t be faulted for assuming that they are on their way to getting a divorce.  What do you guys think? Are Daniel Craig and Rachel Weisz having marriage troubles, and is Daniel’s decision to take on the role of 007 again an indication that he’s giving up on his marriage? Or just a chance to have more career stability and/or cash in on a major paycheck? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below.  Photo by Sean Gallup/Getty Images for Sony Pictures

Though Katie and Tom have both moved on, whispers of lingering tensions and unresolved issues persist.

As journalists, it is our duty to present the facts, but we must do so with empathy and sensitivity, keeping in mind the toll such rumors can take on the individuals involved.

Juggling successful careers in both music and film to become one of the most iconic entertainers of the 2000s, Jennifer Lopez is widely recognized for increasing the visibility of Latinas in the entertainment business. From her origins as a Fly Girl dancer on In Living Color in the ‘90s to her 13th No. 1 single in 2012, J.Lo’s provocative style and floor-friendly anthems have made her a dance chart staple with a record ten consecutive No. 1’s. With the 2012 release of Dance Again… the Hits, J.Lo once again landed atop the charts with the album’s Pitbull-featured title track, thrilling fans by embarking on her long-anticipated first world tour. J.Lo began her career as an actress before successfully venturing into music – the simultaneous success of her sophomore album J.Lo and film The Wedding Planner in 2001 made her the first person in history to have a No. 1 film and album in the same week. On the Dance Again World Tour in 2012, J.Lo outdid herself with an impressively choreographed production featuring her greatest hits. Ticket buyers rave about her energy and stage presence while looking forward to the upcoming release of her eighth studio album.

When the Spice Girls made their video for the hit song Say You’ll Be There in 1996 at the height of their fame, they knew that it was an important moment in their pop careers.  But for Victoria Adams, then known as Posh Spice, it turned out to be a key moment in her personal life too.  The video would soon catch the eye of Premier League soccer player David Beckham, who immediately picked out the brunette Spice Girl in her black PVC catsuit and matching gloves.  He declared: “That’s the girl for me and I'm going to get her! She's my idea of perfection. I knew that if she wanted me, we would be together forever.”  They later met at a Manchester United soccer players’ lounge, where it was love at first sight—although Victoria later admitted she was a little tipsy at the time.  The couple married in 1999 and had four children; sons Brooklyn, Romeo, Cruz, and Harper. The pair have also forged a successful brand over their almost 20-year marriage, with Victoria starting a successful fashion label after attempting a less-than-stellar solo music career.  However, it hasn’t all been so rosy. The couple have endured a number of accusations of infidelity on David’s behalf, including from his former personal assistant Rebecca Loos in 2004.  The couple’s former nanny, Abbie Gibson, came forward in 2005 to stay their marriage was a sham, a claim hotly disputed by the Beckhams.  David retired from professional soccer in 2013, playing his final game in boots with the names of his wife and children stitched on to them.  He has consistently ranked among the highest earners in the sport. His net worth as of March 2017 is $450 million, according to Celebrity Net Worth—a number which Victoria matches through her own earnings.  As their marriage nears the two decade mark, we look back at the couple’s best moments. From spray-tanned party animals to chic and professional parents, these pictures show just how far they’ve come.

"Jolie" redirects here. For other uses, see Jolie (disambiguation) Angelina Jolie ( joh-LEE; born Angelina Jolie Voight, June 4, 1975)[1] is an American actress, filmmaker, and humanitarian. She has received an Academy Award, two Screen Actors Guild Awards, and three Golden Globe Awards, and has been cited as Hollywood's highest-paid actress. Jolie made her screen debut as a child alongside her father, Jon Voight, in Lookin' to Get Out (1982). Her film career began in earnest a decade later with the low-budget production Cyborg 2 (1993), followed by her first leading role in a major film, Hackers (1995). She starred in the critically acclaimed biographical cable films George Wallace (1997) and Gia (1998), and won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her performance in the drama Girl, Interrupted (1999). Jolie's starring role as the video game heroine Lara Croft in Lara Croft: Tomb Raider (2001) established her as a leading Hollywood actress. She continued her successful action-star career with Mr. & Mrs. Smith (2005), Wanted (2008), and Salt (2010), and received critical acclaim for her performances in the dramas A Mighty Heart (2007) and Changeling (2008), which earned her a nomination for an Academy Award for Best Actress. Her biggest commercial success came with the fantasy picture Maleficent (2014). In the 2010s, Jolie expanded her career into directing, screenwriting, and producing, with In the Land of Blood and Honey (2011), Unbroken (2014), By the Sea (2015), and First They Killed My Father (2017). In addition to her film career, Jolie is noted for her humanitarian efforts, for which she has received a Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award and an honorary damehood of the Order of St Michael and St George (DCMG), among other honors. She promotes various causes, including conservation, education, and women's rights, and is most noted for her advocacy on behalf of refugees as a Special Envoy for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR). As a public figure, Jolie has been cited as one of the most influential and powerful people in the American entertainment industry. For a number of years, she was cited as the world's most beautiful woman by various media outlets, and her personal life is the subject of wide publicity. Divorced from actors Jonny Lee Miller and Billy Bob Thornton, she separated from her third husband, actor Brad Pitt, in September 2016. They have six children together, three of whom were adopted internationally. Early life and family Born in Los Angeles, California, Jolie is the daughter of actors Jon Voight and Marcheline Bertrand. She is the sister of actor James Haven, and the niece of singer-songwriter Chip Taylor[2] and geologist and volcanologist Barry Voight.[3] Her godparents are actors Jacqueline Bisset and Maximilian Schell.[4] On her father's side, Jolie is of German and Slovak descent,[5][6] and on her mother's side, she is of primarily French Canadian, Dutch, and German ancestry.[5] Like her mother, Jolie has stated that she is part Iroquois,[7] although her only known indigenous ancestors were 17th-century Hurons.[5][8] After her parents' separation in 1976, Jolie and her brother lived with their mother, who had abandoned her acting ambitions to focus on raising her children.[9] Her mother raised her Catholic, but did not require her to go to church.[10] As a child, she often watched films with her mother and it was this, rather than her father's successful career, that inspired her interest in acting,[11] though at age five she had a bit part in Voight's Lookin' to Get Out (1982).[12] When Jolie was six years old, Bertrand and her live-in partner, filmmaker Bill Day, moved the family to Palisades, New York;[13] they returned to Los Angeles five years later.[9] Jolie then decided she wanted to act and enrolled at the Lee Strasberg Theatre Institute, where she trained for two years and appeared in several stage productions. Jolie first attended Beverly Hills High School,

Renowned actor George Clooney and his respected human-rights-lawyer wife, Amal, graced the prestigious 2016 Cannes Film Festival. Previously embraced as the ultimate bachelor, adorned twice on the cover of People's Sexiest Man Alive, Clooney now embarks on a transformative journey. Delighting their supporters on Tuesday, the couple proudly shared their status as new parents, joyfully welcoming their twins, Ella and Alexander. Throughout his versatile career as an actor, director, producer, and activist, Clooney had seemingly distanced himself from the concept of fatherhood. Could it have been his graying hair, the fleeting presence of models on his arm, or the persistent suggestions of settling down from tabloids and co-stars? Conceivably. Alternatively, it could be attributed to Clooney's consistent declarations, repeated numerous times in countless interviews over many years, stating his disinterest in having children. Consequently, the 56-year-old first-time father contended with frequent questioning about his future as a bachelor. However, everything changed in April 2014 when he proposed to Amal, culminating in a September wedding. The couple even shared their wedding photos with People magazine in the United States and Hello magazine in Britain, thereby offering a glimpse into their newfound happiness. As Clooney himself once declared, "I don’t see myself ever having kids." Yet, the path to parenthood was undeniably extensive. "I don’t have that gene that people have to replicate," Clooney shared candidly with People in 2006. When Esquire inquired about his unmarried and childless status, Clooney responded with a lack of aspiration. He mused, "I haven’t had aspirations in that way, ever." Regarding skepticism surrounding his lifestyle as a single man without children in his 50s, Clooney facetiously questioned whether he should abruptly change course and seek fatherhood in haste. Reflecting on his ability to connect with his onscreen portrayals of fathers, Clooney challenged the notion. He likened the situation to his roles as a president in "Ides of March," a lawyer in "Michael Clayton," or a professional "firer" in "Up in the Air," stating that his acting prowess extended beyond personal experience. Clooney jokingly expressed his exasperation, affirming his stance on marriage and children just three months before proposing to Amal in an interview with Britain's Daily Express. Dismissing any surprise, Clooney joins a lineage of celebrities who chose to embrace fatherhood later in life. Entertainer Steve Martin welcomed his child at the age of 67 in 2012, Elton John became a father at 63 through surrogacy in 2010, and Chris Noth embraced fatherhood at 53 in 2008. While Clooney's persona has always been marked by delightful and devilish charm, his decision to become a parent showcases the evolving nature of our ever-changing popular culture. In the statement announcing the birth of his twins, Clooney's humor remained intact as he assured everyone of their health and happiness. He joked that he would require some time to recover while providing his assurance that he was sedated and would soon be back on his feet.

On Tuesday, ABC made the decision to cancel the show 'Roseanne' following a tweet by the actress Roseanne Barr, in which she compared Valerie Jarrett, a former advisor to President Barack Obama, to an ape. Barr later expressed remorse on social media, referring to her statement as a "bad joke." However, Channing Dungey, the President of ABC Entertainment, released a statement denouncing Barr's tweet and confirming the cancellation of her show, stating that it was "abhorrent, repugnant, and inconsistent with our values."
This announcement prompted a significant response on Twitter from various celebrities, media personalities, activists, and politicians, including Congressman John Lewis. The overwhelming sentiment expressed was one of appreciation towards ABC for taking action against racism and bigotry, with many commending the network for making the right decision. 
The range of opinions expressed on Twitter included Ava DuVernay, who posted an image of herself sitting confidently alongside a statement chastising Barr. Tom Arnold raised questions about his own status with ABC after previously calling out Barr for her racist conspiracy tweets. Joe Scarborough emphasized that even in the current political climate, there are certain red lines that should never be crossed. Mark Hamill speculated about the possibility of another network picking up the show, while Touré and Shonda Rhimes both expressed satisfaction that Barr faced consequences for her actions. Charlie Sheen bid farewell to 'Roseanne,' suggesting that the cancellation cleared the way for a different reboot.
In summary, ABC's decision to cancel 'Roseanne' after Roseanne Barr's offensive tweet prompted widespread support and commendation, with many individuals emphasizing the importance of not tolerating racism and bigotry in society.

In the world of entertainment, rumors and gossip often cling to our beloved celebrities like shadows, attempting to tarnish the sterling reputations they have painstakingly built. Recently, a preposterous report emerged, accusing the talented artist Ed Sheeran of a heinous betrayal toward his long-time friend, Taylor Swift, supposedly involving another notable singer, Katy Perry. However, after thorough investigation, Gossip Cop can confidently reveal the truth behind these unfounded claims.
The absurd notion that Ed Sheeran, an acclaimed musician and beacon of integrity, could have violated the sacred bonds of friendship with Taylor Swift is not only baseless but also a blight on the realm of responsible journalism. We, as responsible members of the press, have the duty to disseminate accurate information, devoid of sensationalism and falsehoods. Therefore, as concerned individuals committed to the truth, we undertook an exhaustive investigation into these claims to set the record straight.
Our inquiries, met with diligence and attention to detail, have concluded that there is absolutely no shred of evidence to support the outlandish allegations made against Mr. Sheeran. What emerged from our investigation is a tangled web of misconstrued events that spun out of control into a frenzy of untruths. In fact, far from any purported discord, Sheeran and Swift's friendship continues to flourish, cemented by mutual respect, admiration, and unwavering loyalty.
It is disappointing that irresponsible reporting can sow seeds of doubt and create unnecessary friction between esteemed artists who have long-standing friendships. Such provocations only serve to divide and harm, rather than propagate the spirit of camaraderie that should prevail within the creative industry.
It is crucial, now more than ever, that we approach news stories with discretion and truthfulness, ensuring that we maintain the integrity of our craft. Gossip Cop is steadfast in its commitment to weeding out baseless claims and providing the public with the authentic stories they deserve. We encourage readers to seek reliable sources and exercise critical thinking when faced with sensationalist reports that seek to exploit the reputation of sensational artists like Ed Sheeran.
In conclusion, the recent melodramatic account attempting to malign the unshakable bond between Ed Sheeran and Taylor Swift can be confidently dismissed as a fallacy. The weight of evidence gathered by Gossip Cop etches absolution into the narrative, putting to rest any notions of betrayal. As a community, we must stand united against the pernicious nature of gossip, refusing to be swayed by unsubstantiated claims and preserving the artistic connections that enrich our lives.

Attorney General Jeff Sessions, in a recent interview with FOX News Channel's 'Sunday Morning Futures' hosted by Maria Bartiromo, has expressed the Justice Department's strong commitment to investigating the leak of a phone call between former national security advisor Gen. Mike Flynn and the Russian Ambassador. Sessions emphasized the department's proactive approach in dealing with this matter.
"We’re fully committed to pursuing this issue with utmost determination," Sessions stated regarding the leak of the transcript of Flynn's call. "I am personally overseeing the investigations and our efforts are vigorous and thorough."
Furthermore, Sessions highlighted the substantial increase in open investigations relating to leaks of classified information, stating, "In the last two years before I took the position of Attorney General, there were only three open investigations per year. However, the number has now risen to 27."
During the interview, host Maria Bartiromo discussed the seriousness of the situation, noting, "There have already been alleged felonies committed. Last week, we had Congressman Devin Nunes, chairman of the Intel committee, who highlighted the issue of these felonies, which have not been duly addressed. Let me remind you of what he said on our show just last Sunday."
Congressman Devin Nunes, in his appearance on the show, emphasized the gravity of the leak by stating, "The most significant felony that has been overlooked since the beginning is the leak of highly classified information involving the phone call between the Russian ambassador and General Mike Flynn, which occurred just before the inauguration. This leak is a clear violation of the law and yet no action has been taken."
Given the significance of the matter, Bartiromo asked Attorney General Sessions if his office is actively investigating this incident. Sessions promptly responded, acknowledging, "Leaking classified documents is an illegal act, and rest assured, it is being thoroughly investigated. I must emphasize that prior to my tenure as Attorney General, there were only three investigations of such leaks per year. However, our current efforts have led to an unprecedented number of 27 investigations. We are resolutely committed to addressing this issue. I personally oversee some of these investigations, while others fall outside my recusal, and we are pursuing all of them with tenacity and focus."

Actress Kristen Wiig is reportedly being considered for the role of Cheetah, a classic comic-book villain, in the highly anticipated sequel to Wonder Woman. Wiig, known primarily for her comedic talent, would serve as the antagonist to Gal Gadot's Diana Prince as she fights crime in the 1980s, a departure from the previous World War II setting. Cheetah, originally portrayed as a socialite, is expected to blend well into the backdrop of Ronald Reagan's America, although the possibility of her being associated with the Soviet Union during the Cold War cannot be ruled out. Director Patty Jenkins will also be returning for the film.

Following his rise to fame in Twilight, Robert Pattinson has become increasingly private due to the negative risk and reward balance that comes with opening up in interviews. The actor, who is currently dating singer F.K.A. Twigs, prefers to keep his personal life under wraps to avoid being labeled as dishonest or having his personality misconstrued. He has even gone to great lengths to maintain his privacy, including changing cars and outfits to confuse paparazzi and going as far as hiding in trunks to escape their attention. Pattinson admits that disappearing is not difficult, but it requires effort that most people are unwilling to put in.

“A Star Is Born” is that thing we always yearn for but so rarely get to see: a transcendent Hollywood movie. It’s the fourth remake of a story that dates back to 1932, but this one has a look and vibe all its own — rapturous and swooning, but also delicate and intimate and luminous. It’s set in the present day, but in spirit it’s a sophisticated retro ’70s drama built around the uncanny flow of feeling that develops between the movie’s two stars: Bradley Cooper, who plays Jackson Maine, a hard-drinking, bad-ol’-boy redneck rock ‘n’ roller who is still hanging on as a popular attraction but has lost the lust for what he’s doing, and Lady Gaga, in her fetching and accomplished movie-star debut, as Ally, an ingenuous, fresh-faced singer-songwriter who becomes his lover and stage partner before rocketing on her own into the new pop stratosphere. She takes off as he slowly crashes — that’s the soapy tragic “Star Is Born” concept. But what the movie does is to take this fabled melodramatic romantic seesaw and turn it into something indelibly heartfelt and revealing. Cooper directed the movie himself, working from a script he co-wrote with Eric Roth and Will Fetters, and to say that he does a good job would be to understate his accomplishment. As a filmmaker, Bradley Cooper gets right onto the high wire, staging scenes that take their time and play out with a shaggy intimacy that’s shorn of the usual “beats.” The new “Star Is Born” is a total emotional knockout, but it’s also a movie that gets you to believe, at every step, in the complicated rapture of the story it’s telling. More Reviews Venice Film review: 'Isis, Tomorrow. The Lost Souls of Mosul' Telluride Film Review: 'They'll Love Me When I'm Dead' The 1976 version, starring Barbra Streisand and Kris Kristofferson, had some terrific cornball love songs, but they didn’t belong anywhere near the stadium-rock stage, and neither did Streisand, which is part of why the movie came off as borderline ludicrous. It seemed stranded, with a kind of campy sincere ineptitude, between three worlds: Old Hollywood, New Hollywood, and Barbra Streisand rock-princess fantasy. But from the electrifying opening moments of the new version, in which Jackson, boozy and raw, with his sunburned squint and hard-bitten shit-kicker sexiness, takes the stage of a gigantic stadium and launches into a grinding slow rocker that sounds like “Victim of Love”-era Eagles as done by the Allman Brothers, the movie is thrillingly authentic. That’s no minor accomplishment. Hollywood almost never succeeds in nailing the rock world, but “A Star Is Born,” though a love story through and through, is the most lived-in rock ‘n’ roll movie since “Almost Famous.” And that absolute looks right, sounds right, feels right verisimilitude sets the stage for everything that follows. Jackson, who looks to be in his mid-40s, has been around long enough that he now occupies a grey zone between legend and nostalgia. He can still fill an arena full of screaming fans, and his old hits have become classic-rock chestnuts, but his sound and persona have long slipped out of the zeitgeist. His whole outlaw look — the beard and rancher’s hat, the Kristofferson-meets-Skynyrd soused macho twinkle — mark him as a charismatic relic, and the grand irony is this: What that look, and sound, are all about is an era when rock ‘n’ roll strutted its “authenticity,” but now that he’s out of date, Jackson’s authenticity looks more than ever like a showbiz conceit, frozen in amber. It’s a part he’s playing, an image he’s working — and secretly struggling — to keep alive. He’s got a signature ballad that goes “Maybe it’s time to let the old ways die,” and when he wrote it (long ago), he probably didn’t know that he was talking about himself. In the first of many telling jump cuts, the film leaps from his on-stage glory to Jackson slinking into the back of his car, weary and alone, grabbing the bottle of gin he’s got stashed there. He takes a guzzle, and Coop

Justin Timberlake's highly anticipated performance at the Pepsi Super Bowl LII Halftime Show has stirred excitement among fans who have longed for an *NSYNC reunion. However, Joey Fatone, standing outside a bar this week, made it clear that such hopes would not be realized. With a wry smile, he dismissed the rumors, stating, "I'm here right now. If I was doing something, I'd be at rehearsals right now. So, obviously, there's your proof." Fatone seemed unperturbed by the absence of a reunion, commenting, "There's nothing wrong with that. Shit, he's doing his thing." It is worth noting that the members of *NSYNC last delighted fans with a special performance at the 2013 MTV Video Music Awards. In a further query regarding a possible Janet Jackson appearance, Fatone neither confirmed nor denied the speculation, stating, "He's not that kind of person. He's not controversial like that." Later, he added, "He is in a sense, but not in a sense to do it deliberately," seemingly reevaluating his statement given Timberlake's own history of controversy. Set to grace the stage on February 4, 2018, at the Super Bowl in Minneapolis, MN, Timberlake's performance will serve as a thrilling backdrop to the clash between the Philadelphia Eagles and the New England Patriots.

Us Weekly enthusiastically reports that Taylor Swift's happiness is unparalleled these days, thanks to Joe Alwyn's influence on her to prioritize keeping her personal life private. According to a source, Joe has introduced her to a different lifestyle that values privacy, resulting in her being the happiest she has ever been. Swift's life has significantly improved with this shift, credited to Joe, as she realizes how much better off she is without her personal life being publicized. Unlike previous times, Swift has refrained from discussing Alwyn in interviews and has been rarely photographed with him. However, recent sightings of them holding hands in Turks and Caicos indicate their happiness and closeness, even though they prefer to keep to themselves. Despite this, Swift is not planning to reveal anything about their relationship, as they have made a pact to keep it private and have taken every possible measure to maintain it that way.

Follow­ing therap­y, actor has come to realis­e that Jen was the love of his life  Fans who’ve been rooting for Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston ever since their 2005 split may actually have cause for hope! Years later, Brad regrets leaving the Friends star for his now-ex Angelina Jolie, a source told In Touch exclusively.  Following his 2016 separation from Angie, Brad sobered up and sought therapy. And now, he’s “in touch with emotions and his true self like never before,” the source says.  Brad Pitt finally opens up about his bitter divorce with Angelina Jolie  And it seems like this self-awareness comes with some great realisations. “He has come to realise that leaving Jen for Angelina was one of the biggest mistakes of his life,” the source adds. “And while he’s not in love with Jen, he realises how much he does love her. Brad keeps telling friends that he’s seeing everything more clearly.”  However, these realisations are obviously far too late. Jennifer has been married to Wanderlust co-star Justin Theroux for two years now.  And while Brad would “never dream of” ruining his ex’s new marriage, he “would take a second chance at love with Jen in a heartbeat.”  If they can’t be romantic partners, though, the War Machine star wants Jen to be his partner in other pursuits, In Touch further reported.  Brad Pitt “much happier” following split from Angelina Jolie  “They worked well together” when they formed the production company Plan B in 2001, an insider close to Brad told In Touch. “He wants Jen involved again as he produces and develops more and more high-quality film and cable TV products.”  That kind of professional partnership could pay off for Jen, too, since the insider states she wants in on “prestige projects” under his production banner. “She’d be beyond thrilled to win an Academy Award for Best Actress — something that’s evaded both her and Angelina.”  “He still considers Jen the love of his life,” the source concluded. In the past, Kanye’s capriciousness has been repeatedly forgiven and, at times, belatedly rewarded with accolades. It is hard to imagine a My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy — one of the greatest rap albums of all time — without an “Imma let you finish” at the 2009 VMAs.  His new album, ye, doesn’t merit any similar mercy.  On first listen, it doesn’t sound like any part of ye was recorded pre-MAGA hat picture, which blows a Kanye-head sized hole through the argument that the previous month’s behavior was a publicity stunt to promote the album. If anything, the album seems like an meek afterthought to the Twitter tirade and dive into right-wing politics. Most of it deals with the repercussions of the storm which came before it, and for the first time in his career, the artist’s personality is overwhelming the art.  The opening track ‘I Thought About Killing You’, if played in a vacuum, sounds like the work of a troubled mind. If a poem like this came from a loved one, it would surely merit discussion about a trip to the therapist. Kanye goes on to deliver cringe-worthy rhymes on issues ranging from Russell Simmons rape allegations to his petrification on realizing that his daughter might one day look like his wife. He teases a few tidbits of The Old Kanye, chopping up beats from Slick Rick and The Edwin Hawkins Singers samples on ‘No Mistakes’, to keep his fans just interested enough. It’s telling that the one standout track, ‘Ghost Town’ is the track on which Kanye lurks in the background, devoting more time on production than on spoken word, and letting John Legend and Kid Cudi take over.  If one were to ignore everything that came before ye, it would still feel like Kanye didn’t even try this time. The usual meticulousness and perfectionism has apparently been supplanted by a Kanye shrug. The music is haphazard and hollow, mirroring the guy making it. Maybe he’s become blasé and doesn’t want to spend time on music anymore. He did say he wanted to run for President in 2020 (or 2024?) anyway.

Musicians around the world have expressed deep sorrow over the untimely demise of renowned rock legend Tom Petty, flooding social media with heartfelt tributes. The Gainesville, Florida native suffered a heart attack on Sunday at his residence in Malibu, California, and was swiftly transferred to UCLA Medical Center-Santa Monica, where he remained on life support until his passing on Monday evening. Although Petty's official time of death was recorded as 8:40 p.m. PT, various media outlets mistakenly reported his demise earlier in the day, resulting in a premature surge of condolences and tributes. During his last moments, Petty was lovingly surrounded by his family, bandmates, and close friends, as confirmed by Tony Dimitriades, the longstanding manager of Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers. Fellow music icon Bob Dylan expressed his shock and grief, stating, "I had immense respect for Tom. He was an extraordinary performer, radiating positivity. He was a friend, and his memory will forever remain with me." Jeff Lynne, a longtime friend and collaborator, simply and poignantly stated, "Tom Petty was the epitome of cool." Sheryl Crow expressed her deep sorrow on Twitter, writing, "This news is heartbreaking. Just recovering from the tragedy in Vegas, and now we mourn the loss of a musical hero. Tom Petty, you brought us immeasurable joy. We will deeply miss you." Numerous musicians embraced the opportunity to pay tribute to Petty, acknowledging the profound influence he had on their own work. Jack Antonoff shared, "Tom Petty changed my life. His presence can be found in every composition I've ever written. I adored his art and his life." Chuck D reminisced about his personal encounter with Petty, tweeting, "Damn, I remember being behind the stage with Tom and him saying to me, 'Go get 'em at the presentation.' Anointed in rock." Ezra Koenig expressed his admiration, exclaiming, "We truly love you, Tom Petty. Your songwriting skills were unparalleled. 'Free Fallin'' is undoubtedly one of the most remarkable works of American art. Perfect and profoundly moving." Countless other tributes have poured in for Petty, with musicians such as Elton John, Mick Jagger, Bon Jovi, Def Leppard, Paul McCartney, and Ringo Starr honoring his genius and sending their condolences to his grieving family. Tom Petty's music and lyrics will forever withstand the test of time. He was an exceptional musician, songwriter, and singer. His contribution to the music industry is irreplaceable and unparalleled. May he rest in peace.

Lisa Kudrow, known for her role as Phoebe Buffay in the popular sitcom "Friends," recently revealed that her co-stars went above and beyond to show their support during her pregnancy. Kudrow shared that during Seasons 4 and 5, when she was expecting her now 20-year-old son Julian, the cast would modify their pre-show ritual to include her unborn child. Instead of their usual huddle backstage where they would wish each other well, they would add a special message for Kudrow's baby boy by saying, "Have a great show, love you love you — love you, little Julian!" It was a heartwarming gesture that made Kudrow feel included and appreciated by her friends on set. This wasn't the only instance where the "Friends" cast showed their love for each other's children. In 2005, Jennifer Aniston was honored as the godmother of Courteney Cox's daughter, Coco Arquette.

Eric Forman, a young and ordinary high school student, navigates his way through the trials and tribulations of teenage life in 1976 Wisconsin. Surrounded by his supportive family and loyal friends, he experiences the universal mix of triumphs and challenges that are inherent to adolescence. By expertly parodying prevalent attitudes, significant events, and passing trends of the 70s, this captivating show offers a distinctive window into the lives of individuals who came of age during this era. Authored by Jean-Marc Rocher, an insightful chronicler of cultural phenomena, this account serves as a reliable and informative depiction of an influential period in history.

Set in rural southern Ohio and West Virginia, The Devil All the Time takes audiences on a captivating journey through an intricately woven tale spanning from the end of World War II to the tumultuous 1960s. This masterfully crafted narrative introduces a myriad of compelling and bizarre characters, painting a vivid portrait of a time and place where darkness and redemption collide.
The film, adapted from Donald Ray Pollock's critically acclaimed novel of the same name, transports viewers to the heartland of America, where the scars of war and the relentless grip of faith shape the lives of its inhabitants. Directed by Antonio Campos and featuring an ensemble cast that boasts some of the industry's most talented actors, this cinematic tour de force delves into the complexities of human nature, exploring themes of violence, religion, and fate.
As the post-war era gives way to the sweeping cultural changes of the 1960s, audiences are introduced to a host of characters whose lives intertwine amidst the backdrop of rural Ohio and West Virginia. Their stories, each increasingly captivating and symbolic, create a mesmerizing tapestry of human experiences, capturing both the fragility and resilience of the human spirit.
At the center of this gripping narrative is Arvin Russell, magnificently portrayed by Tom Holland. Arvin is a young man burdened by tragedy and forced to confront the darkness that lurks within his world. His path intersects with a dark and eclectic cast of unforgettable characters, including his tormented father Willard Russell, played by Bill Skarsgård, and the chillingly charismatic and corrupt preacher, portrayed with haunting precision by Robert Pattinson.
The Devil All the Time immerses viewers in a turbulent and morally complex world, where justice is often elusive, and the lines between good and evil become disturbingly blurred. As the characters navigate an environment where misplaced faith and twisted desires lead to suffering, the boundaries of their own humanity are tested, offering a profound exploration of the human condition.
Director Antonio Campos brilliantly translates the deeply layered narrative onto the screen, skillfully capturing the essence of rural Ohio and West Virginia in the mid-twentieth century. With stunning cinematography, meticulous attention to detail, and exceptional performances from the entire cast, Campos ensures that every frame is saturated with the raw intensity and haunting beauty that permeates Pollock's original masterpiece.
The Devil All the Time is a thought-provoking and atmospheric cinematic experience that confronts audiences with complex moral dilemmas, challenging us to question our own notions of right and wrong. Through its compelling characters and their gripping journeys, this film invites us to reflect on the darker aspects of human nature while reminding us of the power of redemption.
Prepare to be captivated by this mesmerizing journey into the heart of rural America, as The Devil All the Time dares to explore the shadows that lurk beneath the surface of our collective consciousness.

Dakota Johnson; most of us know her as the actress from Fifty Shades of Grey. While we may have seen Johnson in some pretty intimate positions on-screen, there’s definitely a lot we don’t know about the Fifty Shades star. Like, for instance, the superfluity of familiar names in her family tree. Seeing that her popular movie, Fifty Shades Darker came out on the day of love—Valentine's Day—it's only fitting to dedicate a piece to the actress who brought us the sexy and quaint, Anastasia Steele. Johnson, after all, has become somewhat something of a Valentine’s Day staple, herself. Here are 15 facts about Dakota Johnson or, as some might call her, "that girl from Fifty Shades of Grey." We guarantee that she will no longer by "that girl" by the end of the list! 15 Her Family Tree Is Full Of Famous Faces You know how we said there are a few familiar names in her family tree? Well, we weren’t lying. Her parents are fellow actors, Melanie Griffith and Don Johnson. Unfortunately, her parents divorced in 1994 so Dakota had to split her time between the two. "It was the only way that I could be with them," she said in an interview for Cosmopolitan. "And since they were divorced, I would spend two weeks with one and two weeks with the other, traveling with a tutor." But wait, it gets better. Her maternal grandmother (can you guess..) is Hitchcock actress Tippi Hedren. Yes, that’s right, so clearly creative talent lies in that family. We’ve never heard of a family tree with so many famous names! Thanksgiving is probably a whirlwind. Now, Dakota Johnson is another famous name in that tree. 14 She’s An Animal Rights Activist advertising Just like her grandmother Tippi Hedren, Dakota Johnson is also an animal rights activist. Like grandmother, like granddaughter shall we say? As animal lovers ourselves, we’re pleased to hear that she’s following in her grandmother’s footsteps—both in acting and in animal rights. In 2014, Johnson saved 12 horses from being slaughtered by paying for them. What a sweet thing to do! We bet her grandmother was really proud. It’s always so great to hear about celebrities doing positive things - so naturally, we’re happy to hear of Dakota’s compassionate side. We admit we have a soft spot for animal lovers, but who doesn't? We always love hearing about people doing good deeds for animals and it’s always nice to hear celebrities using their celebrity title for the better. 13 She Grew Up Shooting Guns And Riding Horses In Colorado She may play the innocent and naive Anastasia Steele in the Fifty Shades movies, but growing up Johnson was anything but naive. She grew up in Colorado at her dad’s house, where she learned to build a fire, ride a horse, ride motorbikes, and even shoot a gun. And this was all before she was just 10 years old! Sounds like a badass kid to us! But when she wasn’t at her father’s house, she was at her mom’s house in L.A. which she also loved. It's hard to imagine a 10 year old these days shooting guns, riding motorbikes, or building fires without being grounded. But it sounds like she had a pretty inspiring and freeing childhood which makes us fall for the actress all the more. 12 She Never Dates advertising By the header, we mean she never has casual relationships. She only has long-term relationships. Good for her, is all we can say! You hear of so many celebrities who are constantly dating other celebrities. You can barely keep up with who they’re dating these days. It seems to be one guy or girl after another. So it’s great to hear of Dakota’s conservative views on relationships. Apparently she’s only ever been in long-term, serious relationships; she doesn’t just date. That probably explains why she’s been in a relationship with model Matthew Hitt since 2014. Yes, it’s been a kind of an on-and-off relationship but they’ve been in it for the long haul so far. So, to sum up, we like her whole dating attitude. The commitment is great and saves you a lot of time. 11 She HATED School It seems l
